subject: Cohort Learning in the Age of AI: Driving Alignment, Connection, and Impact In Times of Change
body:
Delve into the power of cohort learning.
View this email  in your browser
Almost everyone already uses generative artificial intelligence (AI) at work, but most people are apprehensive about the technology’s impact on their professional and personal lives. While generative AI reduces repetitive tasks, it also makes life at work more isolated. Join this energetic conversation on how cohort learning can help address the challenge of technological disruption by bringing together the best possible content with a rich community of deliberate practice.
During this session
 of the Training Industry Leader Talk, Cohort-Based Learning: Why It Works and How to Make It Work For You, attendees will walk away with insights on:
How to use cohort-based learning to foster organizational alignment and connectedness. 
Why employees seek community involvement during times of uncertainty. 
The benefits of using cohort-based learning to convey complex concepts.
Approaches learning teams can take to strengthen weak ties between employees, customers, partners and communities.
Register now
August 24, 2023 | 11 a.m. - 4 p.m. ET
Register now to attend this session at 12:00 p.m. and any other session during the Training Industry Leader Talk. Can’t attend the live event? Register anyway, and watch the recording when it is available.

subject: LinkedIn Live Today 👔 The Need for Male Allies: The Journey to Better Together
body:
Join us TODAY at 1PM ET for our a conversation with Better Man Movement Founder, Ray Arata and Vice President at Capgemini, Joe Rafter.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Join us 
TODAY
 at 
1:00 p.m ET
 on LinkedIn for a conversation with Ray Arata, Founder of the Better Man Movement, Joe Rafter, Vice President at Capgemini, and Jennifer Brown to discuss the upcoming Better Together Conference. 
 
We'll discuss Joe's participation in the very first Better Man Conference and what made him an early adopter of the movement, toxic masculinity, the need for male allyship, and the evolution of the Better Man Conference to the Better Together Conference. 
 
Please feel free to bring any questions you may have about the new conference this year!
 
We hope to see you there.
 
Register Here
 
Virtual Better Together Conference
October 18th and 19th
 
The 
Better Together
 
Conference
,
 is an event for leaders who are eager to step into their allyship to create inclusive workplaces and for those who may be uncertain of where they fit into the inclusion equation. Presented in partnership by The Better Man Movement and Jennifer Brown Consulting, our goal is help activate everyone, no matter where they are on their learning journey, to be a part of the conversation.
 
Many are striving to build competence, and confidence, to step up, and speak up, but are afraid to say the wrong thing, feeling guilty or even targeted and blamed as the problem. It has become more difficult than ever to practice the imperfect art of allyship - however we identify, because there are few spaces where we can return to the building blocks of inclusion - places where we can deepen our self-awareness, analyze how trust is built, unearth our story, and practice both sharing and listening.
 
This conference is a series of conversations and workshops aimed to foster learning, connection, trust, and empathy, with the intent of articulating a vision for true partnership that includes and enlists 
all of us
.
 
Early bird ends 
TOMOROROW August 15th at
 11:59 pm - secure your tickets while this special lasts.
Secure Your Seat
 
Warmest Regards,
 
Jennifer Brown
CEO & Founder, 
Jennifer Brown Consulting
Author, 
Inclusion
, 
How to Be an Inclusive Leader
, and 
Beyond Diversity
Host, 
The Will To Change
 Podcast
 
Follow me on 
LinkedIn
, 
Twitter
, 
Instagram
, and 
Facebook
Connect with Us
 
 
 
 
Jennifer Brown Consulting, 20 E 9th Street, Suite 4U, New York, NY 10003

body:
Review the latest resources from Training Industry.

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Our team is gearing up to end the year strong, bringing you more great content, events and resources to help you spark new ideas and connect with other learning leaders. Here’s a peek at what we have in store:

We will also be addressing relevant topics on our website, including skills mapping, digital fluency in the workplace, learning technologies and how to make learning stick. If you’re interested in writing, you can 
learn more here
.
I hope you find the resources in this email helpful as you embark on a new week. We love hearing from you, so email us with your thoughts at 
editor@trainingindustry.com

Michelle Eggleston Schwartz, CPTM
Editor in Chief 
[Article] L&D Leaders: 4 Ways to Share Your Thought Leadership With Training Industry
Are you a thought leader in the L&D industry with ideas and tips to share with your peers? If so, check out this 
LinkedIn article

Read the Article
 
Identify Your Training Teams' Strengths and Weaknesses
Training Industry research has identified seven core responsibilities and associated competencies that make up our 
Training Manager Competency Model™
. Based on this model, our Training Team Assessment gives you a holistic picture of your teams’ strengths and weaknesses, allowing you to create a targeted plan for their professional development. Use our 
free assessment tool

Learn More
 
[State of the Industry Report] The Sales Training Market
Staying up to date on the latest research and trends is time-consuming but essential. Luckily, we’ve done the research and gathered the insights for you in our new report, “

.” In this report, you’ll find all the information you need to gain a competitive edge and stay ahead in the sales market. With data on trends, modalities, market projections, sourcing practices and more, our newly released report has the answers you need to stay on top of the sales training market.

With thousands of training vendors across the L&D landscape, choosing the right partner can be a daunting task. Save time by starting your search with the

subject: Training Needs Assessment Resources for the Learning Leader
body:
Master the skill training managers rate as the most difficult.
View this email in your browser
.
Master Critical
Skills With Training
Industry Resources
Courses to Close Your Skill Gaps
4 Steps to Needs Analysis
Achieve Targeted Upskilling. Close Skills Gaps.
According to Training Industry 
research
, needs assessment is one of the most difficult responsibilities of a training manager, with only 10% of training professionals indicating that they excel in it. But, there's many incentives to master this responsibility: Those who rate themselves as excellent at needs assessment report salaries that average more than $30K higher than those who rate themselves as only average.
Training Industry provides resources that will help you master the responsibility that training managers rate as one of the most difficult, and pave the way for you to transform your L&D department into a high-performing training function.
needs analysis
/nēdz • əˈnæl.ə.sɪs/ 
noun
A formal, systematic process of identifying and evaluating training that should be done, or specific needs of an individual or group of employees, customers, suppliers, etc. Needs are often referred to as “gaps,” or the difference between what is currently done and what should be performed. Also referred to as a “gap analysis,” or “needs assessment.”
 
QUICKLY DEVELOP YOUR
NEEDS ANALYSIS SAVVY
Conducting a thorough and effective training needs assessment is the 
only way 
to ensure that you are directing your time and resources toward what your organization really needs. Training Industry's 
Needs Assessment Certificate
 will equip you with the skills to conduct your analysis like a pro, and finally stop wasting time and resources on training that doesn't address real issues. Click below to learn more or view the 
upcoming session
 happening September 13-14.
LEARN MORE
 
GET THE PROJECT
PLANNING CHECKLIST
Great training starts with a robust needs assessment that highlights skills gaps and, with them, learning opportunities to close them. When considering potential solutions, conducting an effective training needs assessment should be your top priority: That’s why we created a free step-by-step checklist to assist you alongside your needs assessment journey. Don’t let your training needs assessment fears hold you back from delivering great training.
LEARN MORE
 
Learning Leader or Undercover Detective?
Tune into episode 54 of the Business of Learning podcast to learn how learning leaders can channel their undercover detective persona and identify true learning needs. 
Listen Now >>
4 Steps to Conduct an Effective Training Needs Analysis
  
Step 1
Understand Your Desired Outcome.
  
Step 2
Assess Current Performance.
  
Step 3
Identify the Cause of Skills Gaps.
  
Step 4
Determine Future Skills Needed.
Want to see these steps in depth? View the 
infographic
.
 
 
 
Needs Analysis: The 
Most Important
 Best Practice
"Listening to uncover real business problems and needs" is considered the 
single most important 
best practice for great training, with 71%
 
of training professionals rating it as 
"very important."
 Additionally, training professionals who consider this best practice as "very important" tend to come from 
higher performing 
training organizations. 
Great Training Organizations Research
 
Must-Read Articles on Needs Assessment
Successful Upskilling and Reskilling Begins With a Needs Analysis
Needs Assessments for Upskilling and Reskilling
How to Conduct a Learner Needs Analysis
 
PRO TIP: Zeroing In On Needs Analysis For Learning Tech
When considering solutions for your organization's learning technology needs, make sure to first list all platform features, and then categorize features into "need to have," "nice to have" and "not important." This will help you narrow down your options in order to choose a solution that truly meeting organizational needs.
Get More Tips

subject: One month from TODAY: SIETAR USA Saturday Seminar
body:
'Intercultural vs. Inclusion: One Looks Out, the Other Looks In!' - 9-Sept-2023 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
SATURDAY SEMINAR: 
'Intercultural vs. Inclusion: 
One Looks Out, the Other Looks In!'
 
Your Seminar Leader:
Jay Cafferata, MS, CDE
 
 
 
 
September 9, 2023 @ 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
Have 
YOU
 registered yet? This educational event is only one month from TODAY!
Don't miss this Saturday Seminar!  
Jay Cafferata
 will focus on how we unknowingly and unfortunately perpetuate racist ideology, colonialism, oppression, and discrimination in the words we use.  We'll be discussing the breakdown in communication between intercultural and inclusion dialogues. When we think about intercultural, we think international, global or worldwide – but when we think about inclusion, we think local, internal and the workplace. Why are we having these different conversations to the same discourse? What is the breakdown between these two seemingly different sets of vocabulary?
This interactive 4-hour session will include videos, polling, and breakout sessions. Participants are encouraged to join using a device that has a camera and a microphone as well as a secondary device like a phone or computer that allows for multiple windows to be open at the same time for the polling.
Participants will discuss and reflect on:
The words we use to describe others
Historical perspectives on these two lexicons
Global vs Local
The direction of impact: who is studying who?
At the conclusion of the presentation, participants will have:
A greater recognition of how inclusion and intercultural fit together.
The basic awareness of how we present ourselves in an environment or culture that is not necessarily our own.
Strategies to be more aware of where we are as professionals.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Registration Fees
$20 for Students
$45 for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
$65 for non-members
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Student-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Your Seminar Leader
Jay Cafferata, MS, CDE
Mr. Cafferata is a well-known speaker and advocate for issues involving Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging. He considers himself a Social Justice Warrior and has spent decades as an advocate for the Sexual and Gender Minority Community. He has over 20 years of experience working with families of children with special needs. He has a master’s degree in communication studies from University of Nevada, Reno. and an associate degree in Deaf Studies from Western Nevada College. Mr. Cafferata is also a Certified Diversity Executive. He can be reached at 
jay@asltraining.com
.

subject: The world of work is constantly evolving—are you on top of DE&I trends?
body:
Here’s a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplaces. 
 
 
How can you ensure 
you’re on top of DE&I trends?
INCLUSION 2023
 brings together experts and thousands of HR and DE&I professionals from across industries, so that you can expand your thinking and 
keep pushing positive impact forward in the world of work
. 
Here are a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain 
diverse
, 
equitable
 and 
inclusive
 workplaces. 
 
  
 
Data & Technology will be your distinguisher
 
You need to collect data to 
measure the effectiveness of your DE&I strategy
, but data can be used creatively to ensure you hit your goals. Employee surveys can highlight potential social impact initiatives such as volunteer work and sustainability, 
improving culture
 and 
reducing turnover
 in the long term. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve dedicated an entire content track to 
technology & accessibility
 to help you harness the power of technology while remaining cognizant of employee needs, with sessions like 
ChatGPT: Disruptor or Enabler?
 with 
Carol A. Kiburz, SHRM-SCP
. 
  
  
 
Gender identity will continue to take center stage
 
Words matter, and how employees choose to identify is important for mental health and overall office well-being. It’s 
critical
 that leaders take a pulse on how your organization engages with gender diversity and updates forms and surveys to reflect overall awareness. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve tailored sessions around 
optimizing employee well-being
 at every level, with sessions like 
WORDS MATTER: The Case for Inclusive Communication Across Generations
 with 
Joy Johnson-Carruthers
. 
  
  
 
Invest in Leadership
 
Outdated leadership programs will continue to be overhauled and rebuilt to emphasize DE&I strategy and 
maximize employee retention
. Employees are no longer impressed with old-guard leadership tactics—your approach must be 
authentic
 and 
transparent
 in order to build trust and maximize engagement. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve built our programming to 
maximize leadership potential
 and 
invest in DE&I strategy
, with sessions like 
The Three Big Chasms of New Diverse Leadership
 with 
Guillermo Mendoza
. 
  
 
Don’t fall behind on DE&I trends
. Join thousands of your peers and industry experts at 
INCLUSION 2023
 this 
Oct. 30 - Nov. 1
 in 
Savannah, Ga
. Last year this conference sold out so don’t delay and 
secure your seat today
! 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
  
CHECK OUT THIS 
PRECONFERENCE OPPORTUNITY 
  
 
 
 
Inclusive Workplace Culture:
Leading and Sustaining a Culture Transformation
* 
 
John Baldino
 
SHRM-SCP, MSHR, SPHR 
 
Numerous research studies conﬁrm that diverse workforces lead in innovation, productivity and proﬁtability. The key to unlocking these organizational benefits is to...

subject: Are You Prepared for AI in the Workplace?
body:
Learn the risks and benefits of AI with SHRM.
 
 
Despite concerns about 
automation replacing human workers
,
 research shows 
artificial intelligence (AI)
 is most successful when coupled with a human touch. 
Humans are still better suited to jobs that involve data analysis, software development, or creativity and jobs that are less likely to be automated, such as marketing and sales. But the reality is that AI is all around us, and its applications and usage will continue to grow. 
Join SHRM today
 to find out how AI can help you prepare for the future of work and AI's place in it. 
 
 
JOIN NOW
 
 
 
EXCLUSIVE RESOURCES
 
 
 
 
 
 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential
Earn the 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential 
and 
 
begin your journey into the field of people analytics by investigating relevant, real-world business issues and effectively communicating data-supported findings. 
 
 
 
 
ChatGPT and AI in the Workplace Hub Page
 
 
Explore the latest articles
, toolkits and more on utilizing ChatGPT and other forms of AI at work.
 
 
 
 
 
Create Your Own AI Usage Policy
Large corporations are 
increasingly embracing AI
. Learn how to stand out and be a part of a new reality by creating your own usage policy.
 
 
 
 
HR Is Embracing ChatGPT But Still Wary of Risks
According to experts, HR professionals who understand and use ChatGPT and other forms of AI are likely to 
replace HR professionals who don't.

subject: Drive Your Career Trajectory With a Professional Development Plan
body:
Great careers don't just happen — make your plan today!
View this email in your browser
.
 
Achieving the learning and development (L&D) career of your dreams requires commitment to continuously developing your skills as a learning leader. Imagine what you could achieve by really investing in your professional success.
It's often difficult to know where to start, but professional development doesn't have to be intimidating! Here are a few tips to get you started:
Make (
and stick to
) a personalized professional development plan. 
This template
, based on the seven core responsibilities of training management, will get you started.
Explore available resources like 
webinars
, 
podcasts
 and 
articles
 to learn more about the L&D topics that interest you.
Consider investing in a professional certification. Professional certifications, like Training Industry's 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 credential, are associated with 
higher salaries
, and training professionals tend to rate them as being more beneficial than advanced degrees.
To achieve your goals, you need a plan with actionable steps to get you there. Let 
Training Industry Courses
 be your one-stop-shop for your professional development needs. Click below to access your professional development plan template and get started!
Start My Professional Development Plan
 
Learn More About Certification
 
 
Worth Every Penny!
"[
The CPTM
] program 
exceeded my expectations in every way
. From the pre-work to the practicum, each experience confirmed that training needs are evolving. Training managers must evolve as well. Personally, I enjoyed the comradery from colleagues addressing a business need in their industry. It confirmed that training is in great hands! Overall, the experience was supportive and provided a safe space to build capability. Once earned, the access to the CPTM network is the cherry on top!"
— Keith Gasteral, CPTM, Learning Consultant, AmerisourceBergen

subject: Difficult colleague? Here’s what to do.
body:
Take control with the Getting Along Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Dealing with Difficult People at Work. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS
COLLECTIONS
TOOLS
CASE STUDIES
HBR STORE
 
 
 
Take control of difficult situations at work
 
Work relationships can be hard. Dealing with difficult people can dampen creativity and productivity, degrade decision-making abilities, and cause us to disengage. Take control with the 
Getting Along Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Dealing with Difficult People at Work
. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
In the kit:
 
Ebook: 
Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone
This informative guide, written by workplace expert and HBR podcast host Amy Gallo, provides a practical, evidence-based approach to dealing with difficult people at work. 
 
 
 
 
The Assessment Tool
By answering a few simple questions, you’ll determine which of the 8 types of difficult colleagues you’re most likely dealing with. 
 
 
 
 
Support Tools
You also get additional tools to help you move forward with the recommendations: 
A Tactics Tracker
 so you can know which solutions are most effective.
A Decision Guide
 to help determine whether to escalate the problem.
The Last Resort Tool
 with other steps you may choose to take if all else fails.
 
 
 
 
6 Coaching Podcasts
In each 30-minute podcast, Amy Gallo coaches a professional on how to navigate a real-life situation with a challenging coworker. 
 
 
 
 
The Handbook
Get the most for your toolkit investment with step-by-step guidance on how to use each tool most effectively. 
 
 
This indispensable toolkit will help you navigate your toughest interactions and relationships at work—and build interpersonal resilience in the process. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
Discover more tools
Master essential business and leadership skills with downloadable tools you can use right away. Get instant access today.

subject: Attend SIETAR USA's September 2023 Webinar!
body:
'Exploring African Culture' w/ Geremie Sawadago ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WEBINAR: 
'Exploring African Culture'
Your Presenter:
Geremie Sawadago, 
HR Manager, World Bank Group
 
 
 
 
September 13, 2023 @ 11:30 AM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
This webinar will explore
 the rich diversity in African cultures and discuss the case for African cultural unity around six shared cultural values, including: 
(1) communication style; (2) individualism/collectivism; (3) power distance; (4) uncertainty avoidance; (5) polychromic use of time; and (6) long term/short term orientation. 
 Participants will further their knowledge, appreciation and understanding of African cultures and learn tips to effectively communicate and interact with Africans in both a professional and personal context. 
 
Registration = FREE for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
 
Registration = $25.00 for nonmembers
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Geremie Sawadago
Geremie Sawadogo is HR Manager at The World Bank Group in Washington DC.
  
Prior to joining the Bank, Geremie was the Country Director for the US Peace Corps in Benin, and he has also taught education and intercultural communication and directed international education programs at universities and community colleges across the US.
  
Geremie is a published 
author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark.

author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark.

Are YOU ready to serve? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETAR USA Members and Colleagues,
 
 
 
 
 
The SIETAR USA leadership team values diversity in all its forms and is committed to creating and fostering an inclusive environment for all SIETAR USA members. To that end, we are issuing the 
2023 Call for Nominations for the Board of Directors of SIETAR USA
. We encourage all members of our community to participate in the Board of Directors election process to support our efforts to cultivate a culture that embraces and values diversity, equity, and inclusion. 
You may nominate yourself or another member of the organization. Any candidate for Board positions must meet the following criteria in addition to role-specific requirements listed in each position description:
 
 
 
 
1.
     
Possess a strong background and understanding of intercultural communications and/or fields of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB).
 
 
 
 
 
2.
     
Be a member in good standing with SIETAR USA (or willing to become a member).
 
 
 
 
3.
     
Have attended at least one SIETAR USA conference in recent years.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Open Positions
 
There are a total of five (5) board positions open for nominations in 2023:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
View Open Positions for 2023 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Nominations Process-Details 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
All nominations must be submitted using the form provided (click the 'Submit Nomination' button shown below) NO LATER THAN:
 
Friday, September 1, 2023 
5 PM CST
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Submit Nomination 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process! 
Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
admin@sietarusa.org
.
Thank you for supporting SIETAR USA!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent by SIETAR USA 
PO Box 548 • Wheaton, IL • 60187

subject: Activate Your Allyship this International Allyship Day
body:
Happy International Allyship Day! This holiday is dedicated to celebrating and promoting the power of allyship across the globe.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Happy International Allyship Day - a day dedicated to celebrating and promoting the power of allyship across the globe. Today, we come together to recognize the importance of, and our role in, standing up for one another, fostering inclusivity, and building bridges of support and understanding.
 
Being an effective ally means standing up for equity and inclusion and speaking out against discrimination and exclusion. But practicing sustained allyship is harder than it looks. It requires examining how we may be complicit in perpetuating stereotypes, biases, and discrimination, just by participating in our day-to-day role in the workplace. It means getting comfortable with the uncomfortable and persevering when we make mistakes and get it wrong. These challenges are really all about introspection - reflecting on our own role and identity, learning more about the lived experiences of other identity groups, and translating our learning into action.
 
I often say allyship is not a destination, it is a journey. Allyship does not happen on its own, it is a conscious action that one continuously strives for on a daily basis. 
 
Today, my ask of you is to recommit to your allyship and take action to make the world a more equitable and inclusive place, so everyone can thrive.
Build Your Allyship Toolkit at 
the Virtual Better Together Conference this Oct 18-19
 
Join us for the
 
Better Together Conference
,
 an event for leaders who are eager to
 
step into their allyship to create inclusive workplaces and for those who may be uncertain of where they fit into the inclusion equation.
 
Many are striving to build competence, and confidence, to step up, and speak up, but are afraid to say the wrong thing, feeling guilty or even targeted and blamed as the problem. It has become more difficult than ever to practice the imperfect art of allyship - however we identify, because there are few spaces where we can return to the building blocks of inclusion - places where we can deepen our self-awareness, analyze how trust is built, unearth our story, and practice both sharing and listening. 
 
The Better Together Conference
 is a series of conversations and workshops aimed to foster learning, connection, trust, and empathy, with the intent of articulating a vision for true partnership that includes and enlists 
all of us
. 
 
Ticket prices increase 
August 15th
 - secure your tickets while early bird rates last. 
Secure my Ticket
 
Group Ticket Packages & Sponsorships
 
There are currently limited group ticket packages and sponsorships available for organizations who want to be more involved in this transformational event. Please inquire below for more information.
 
Inquire Here
 
Warmest Regards,
 
Jennifer Brown
CEO & Founder, 
Jennifer Brown Consulting
Author,

,

, and

subject: Are You Prepared for AI in the Workplace?
body:
Learn the risks and benefits of AI with SHRM.
 
 
Despite concerns about 
automation replacing human workers
,
 research shows 
artificial intelligence (AI)
 is most successful when coupled with a human touch. 
Humans are still better suited to jobs that involve data analysis, software development, or creativity and jobs that are less likely to be automated, such as marketing and sales. But the reality is that AI is all around us, and its applications and usage will continue to grow. 
Join SHRM today
 to find out how AI can help you prepare for the future of work and AI's place in it. 
 
 
JOIN NOW
 
 
 
EXCLUSIVE RESOURCES
 
 
 
 
 
 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential
Earn the 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential 
and 
 
begin your journey into the field of people analytics by investigating relevant, real-world business issues and effectively communicating data-supported findings. 
 
 
 
 
ChatGPT and AI in the Workplace Hub Page
 
 
Explore the latest articles
, toolkits and more on utilizing ChatGPT and other forms of AI at work.
 
 
 
 
 
Create Your Own AI Usage Policy
Large corporations are 
increasingly embracing AI
. Learn how to stand out and be a part of a new reality by creating your own usage policy.
 
 
 
 
HR Is Embracing ChatGPT But Still Wary of Risks
According to experts, HR professionals who understand and use ChatGPT and other forms of AI are likely to 
replace HR professionals who don't.

subject: The Meaning of ‘Woke,’ What Happened When States Banned Affirmative Action?, The ADA Turns 33, more
body:
Be committed to ongoing learning and improvement.
To view this email as a webpage, 
click here.
                                                            
 
 
 
 
SHRM’s Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
 News
 
Aug. 7, 2023
 
 
 
 
You’re just getting started.
Access compliance alerts, tools and more.
JOIN NOW
 
 
 
 
 
The Meaning of ‘Woke’
 
Many companies fear being perceived as “too woke,” especially in advance of the 2024 election cycle. The recent Supreme Court ruling that rolls back affirmative action efforts for college admissions only adds more anxiety to the question of how companies should address so-called “woke” programs. 
 
 
 
What Happened When States Banned Affirmative Action?
Racial diversity in the workplace declined in several states in the years after they outlawed affirmative action in college admissions decisions, according to research by Harvard University. Here are some ways HR professionals can continue to maintain a diverse workplace in light of the Supreme Court’s recent ruling.
 
Advertisement 
 
 
 
 
 
Create a Compelling Employer Value Proposition 
Workers’ priorities have shifted, and companies need to do more to attract and retain staff. Babbel for Business is here to help you redefine your employer value proposition, keeping you competitive in today’s labor market and helping your employees thrive.
Download the eBook now.
 
 
 
 
 
The ADA Turns 33: Reflecting on Progress Made, Challenges That Remain
 
In the 33 years since its passage, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) has boosted the employment prospects of millions of people with disabilities. Despite these strides, disability-rights advocates say employers can do more to create a truly inclusive workplace for these workers. 
 
 
 
DOJ to Propose New ADA Web Accessibility Rule
 
The Department of Justice (DOJ) is set to propose new ADA standards to ensure that websites and mobile applications run by state and local governments are accessible to people with disabilities. If approved, the rule could eventually lead to private businesses being held to similar technical standards. 
 
Advertisement 
 
 
 
 
 
White Paper: Family Building Benefits & Policies 
The definition of family is broadening. That’s why family building benefits represent a key area to consider as part of your corporate DE&I strategy. Learn how, why, and questions to ask as a starting point.
Get the white paper now 
 
 
America Is Getting Older. How Will an Aging Population Impact Employers?
 
The median age in the U.S. continues to rise and population growth is slowing, according to new federal data. Learn how these changes to the workforce will impact staffing moving forward. 
 
 
 
Resumes with They/Them Pronouns More Likely to Be Ignored
 
A new survey revealed that job applicants who include gender-neutral pronouns on their resumes are less likely to be contacted by employers. Here are ways HR can eliminate gender bias during the hiring process. 
 
 
 
Should Chief Diversity Officers Report to HR?
 
Most chief diversity officers globally tend to sit two levels below the CEO, often reporting to HR, according to recent research. Sometimes that works well—but sometimes there are disadvantages to having diversity, equity and inclusion professionals report to HR. 
 
Advertisement 
 
 
 
 
 
Return on Investment for your DEI initiatives
 
Join us for a thought-provoking session where we discuss why DEI is an important facet of the employee experience, the business benefits of successfully embedding DEI into the employee experience, and steps towards a successful DEI journey.
Register for free now
 
 
 
Strategies to Support Working Parents of Children with Developmental Disabilities
 
Parents who work and care for a child with disabilities struggle to balance those responsibilities. Two parents of children with developmental disabilities spoke to 
SHRM Online
 about the value of empathetic employers who accommodate the needs of caregivers. 
 
 
PLAN AHEAD 
 
NOW
New Version of Form I-9 Now Available
The new version of Form I-9 was released by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services on Aug. 1. Employers can use the previous version of the form through Oct. 31, 2023. After that, all employers must use the revised Form I-9.
NOW
VETS-4212 Filing Cycle (Through Sept. 30)
Contractors and subcontractors who enter into or modify a contract or subcontract with the federal government—and whose contract meets the criteria set forth in the applicable legislation or regulations—are required to report annually on their affirmative action efforts in employing veterans. Data reported through Form VETS-4212 is used by the Office of Federal Contractor Compliance Programs in compliance evaluations.
NOW
Colorado POWR Act Effective
Gov. Jared Polis has signed the Protecting Opportunities and Workers’ Rights (POWR) Act into law. The POWR Act expands the Colorado Anti-Discrimination Act by adding types of conduct that constitute harassment.
aUG
30
Deadline for In-Person Inspection of I-9s
Employers that began conducting virtual employment eligibility verifications during the pandemic should begin physical inspections of completed I-9 forms as soon as possible in anticipation of the Aug. 30 deadline.
AUG
31
District of Columbia TWWFA Training Deadline
The District of Columbia’s Tipped Wage Workers Fairness Amendment (TWWFA) Act requires covered employers to provide anti-sexual harassment training to their employees, managers, owners and operators.
SEP
1
Texas Prohibits Hairstyle Discrimination
With the Sept. 1 effective date fast approaching, it’s time for Texas employers to prepare for a new law prohibiting discrimination based on hairstyles.
SEP
17
New York Statewide Pay Transparency Law
Covered employers in New York state will soon have pay transparency obligations related to job advertisements.
OCT
Domestic Violence Awareness Month
Domestic violence isn’t limited to the home. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention indicated that intimate partner violence can lead to injuries that keep employees from working, negatively affect productivity and cause other effects that impact workers’ careers.
OCT
18
International Pronouns Day
It is becoming more common for individuals to specify which pronouns they want others to use when referencing them. International Pronouns Day, observed this year on Oct. 18, is an opportunity for employers to foster respect for and educate their workforces about personal pronouns.
OCT
30
INCLUSION 2023 (Through Nov. 1)
Join us at INCLUSION 2023 in Savannah, Ga., or online to enact real change in your world of work.
NOV
22
New York City Bans Height and Weight Discrimination
New York City Mayor Eric Adams has signed a law that will prohibit discrimination based on a person’s height or weight. The new law will apply to employment, housing and public accommodations.
 
SHRM WEBCASTS COMING SOON 
 
 
From Diversity to Inclusivity
 
Aug. 8, 2 p.m. ET / 11 a.m. PT 
Sponsor:
 
APTMetrics
 
In this facilitated session, a group of executive psychologists and expert panelists will discuss how some companies are overcoming challenges that have hindered organizations from realizing their diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility aspirations. They will focus on specific actions organizations can take now to advance and accelerate their change efforts. The session will address how organizations are breaking through systemic barriers that have thwarted inclusivity efforts and impacted engagement results. The group will also discuss how to better prepare leaders to make immediate improvements and impact in hiring and selection calibration and decision-making while helping to diversify enterprises’ talent pipelines. 
 
 
 
Navigating the Path to Inclusion: Strategies for Overcoming DE&I Challenges
 
Aug. 14, 2 p.m. ET / 11 a.m. PT 
Sponsor:
 
Culture Amp
 
The pursuit of diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) has become a crucial focus for organizations across the globe. In this program, we will discuss compelling research by shedding light on the perspectives of HR decision-makers and employees regarding DE&I initiatives in the U.S. and Canada and also explore practical initiatives that organizations can adopt to foster a more equitable and inclusive workplace for everyone. You’ll learn more about the latest findings on DE&I in the U.S. and Canada, including how to bridge the perception-experience gap and foster equitable and inclusive workplaces. 
 
 
 
How to Build a Diverse, Inclusive Workplace
 
Aug. 15, 2 p.m. ET / 11 a.m. PT 
Sponsor:
 
J. J. Keller
 
Diversity and inclusion must be embraced throughout an entire organization in order to produce positive long-term results. Even in the most diverse and inclusive organizations, there are always challenges to overcome and unwelcome behaviors to address. This webcast will discuss diversity and inclusion in the workplace, including communication methods, common practices and programs that create equal opportunities within a diverse team, how to comply with anti-discrimination laws, and more. 
 
 
 
The Critical Role of Line Managers in Making DE&I a Reality
 
Aug. 25, noon ET / 9 a.m. PT 
Sponsor:
 
Circa
 
To effect change and transform the culture of a company, line managers need to be aligned, bought in, engaged, empowered and equipped with the training, policies, framework and tools they need to operationalize diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging in the day-to-day management of the organization and its teams. During this program, you’ll acquire new insight on identifying the potential challenges in engaging line managers, take away tools and resources to help line managers practice conscious inclusion in day-to-day management, and more. 
 
 
View the complete schedule of 
SHRM webcasts
. 
 
 
EXPRESS REQUEST 
 
 
SCOTUS Affirmative Action Ruling: Impact on Employers
 
On June 29, the U.S. Supreme Court (SCOTUS) voted in a 6-3 decision to curb affirmative action in higher education—ending a four-decade precedent that allowed colleges and universities to broadly consider applicants’ race in their admissions processes. What impact might this ruling have on employers and the workplace? Visit SHRM’s 
SCOTUS Affirmative Action Ruling: Impact on Employers
 Express Request. 
 
 
HR JOBS 
 
Need to hire highly qualified HR candidates or looking to move your career forward?
SHRM HR Jobs can help you reach your goals by connecting top employers with premier HR professionals. Now more user-friendly and with new features, including the ability to filter candidates by SHRM credentials. 
Visit SHRM HR Jobs to learn more
.
Director, Human Resources Community of Practice
 - University of Oregon - Eugene, Ore. (Onsite)
Director of People and Culture
 - Barasch McGarry - New York City (Onsite)
Manager of Human Resources, People and Culture
 - National Public Housing Museum - Chicago (Hybrid)
 
 
USEFUL LINKS 
 
For 75 years, SHRM and HR have worked together to drive historic change in the world of work. What can we change next?
​SHRM podcasts feature insightful interviews, captivating conversations and timely tips for anyone who wonders about the workplace.
Improve your score on this HR quiz: How Much Do You Know About Conducting Background Checks?
 
 
FEATURED WHITE PAPERS
 
 
 
Harness the Power of Global Mobility for DE&I
 
 
OFFERED BY: Localyze 
 
Global Mobility is no longer a “nice-to-have” aspect of talent management. It is a “must-have” that is integral to the future of work and DE&I initiatives. In our guide, you will learn what considerations to make to ensure your global mobility policies are keeping pace with the latest DE&I expectations and trends. 
 
READ MORE
 
 
Global Fertility 
at Work Report
 
 
OFFERED BY: Carrot 
 
Fertility is not only a global health care concern, but also an important workplace issue. Read this full report for more insights on how fertility can impact people at work, and learn why fertility benefits are critical to recruitment, retention and inclusivity in the workplace. 
 
READ MORE
 
 
Access more content and insights from 
SHRM’s White Paper Library
. 
 
 
 
 
Connect with us on social!
 
  
  
  
  
 
1800 Duke Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314 USA

subject: Summer Recap & Fall Invitations
body:
It's been several weeks since my last message to you. I took some time off in July, but please know that International House was buzzing wit
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Can't see this message? 
View in a browser
 
Oh my where did the summer go!
 
The last time I wrote I sent an invitation to our Ribbon Cutting. I hope you were able to join us. It was an amazing celebration and was great to see the halls full of our friends and neighbors.
It's been several weeks since my last message to you. I took some time off in July, but please know that International House was buzzing with activity.  
 
We ran our summer program, Rising Readers, in July adding a new site, Winding Springs Elementary. Our team completed the program with record breaking retention and improvement numbers!
Our adult ESL program finished their first class cycle at our new building with record enrollment resulting in a wait list for all classes.
 
Our legal clinic is on track to surpass their 2023 goals as they continue to see families and individuals from Afghanistan, Ukraine, the Congo, Cuba, and Haiti (just to name a few).
 
And, August has started full steam ahead!
 
This year, 
The Journey
 will be coordinated in partnership with Blumenthal Performing Arts during the 
Charlotte International Arts Festival
. Together we recently launched the 
Call for Artist
 and hope that you will share this exciting opportunity with your friends, family, and colleagues.
 
Tickets for 
Tapas and Testimonials
 are now available! You don't want to miss this year's event being held at The Revelry in Camp North End. We will present to you three testimonials, international tapas, and amazing silent auction items.
There is always more going on than I can put in these emails, so please make sure you follow us on social and check out our 
website
 often.  
 
Autumn Weil
Executive Director
 
P.S. I hope that you have been reading our 
blog
!
 
OUR NEW ADDRESS: 1611 East 7th Street, Charlotte, NC, USA
704-333-8099
Join us on Facebook
Check out our redesigned site!

subject: You're Invited to a Free Negotiation Workshop for L&D Professionals!
body:
Learn how to tackle negotiation challenges every learning leader faces.
View this email  in your browser
We’re thrilled to invite you to a free virtual mini-workshop on negotiation for learning and development (L&D) professionals, courtesy of NextArrow. The workshop is a research-based, practical, and playful experience designed explicitly for tackling negotiation challenges that every L&D professional encounters at work. 
The workshop will be led by NextArrow’s CEO, Roi Ben-Yehuda, a former negotiation professor at Columbia University. His facilitation will provide:  
An introduction to negotiation fundamentals. 
Frameworks for negotiating budgets with management.  
Strategies for generating creative solutions with vendors. 
Engaging discussions, exercises and real-life examples.

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 August 6, 2023
body:
Virtual reality e-book, new infographic and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As a learning leader, it's more important than ever to make sure your skills are up to date. To help you stay on top of your own professional development (and not just your learners'), we're featuring our 
Training Manager Competency Model™
, which describes the crucial competencies and responsibilities of successful training managers.
Also, since accurate measurement is one of the core responsibility areas of modern training managers, we're featuring 
this month's infographic
, which outlines three metrics to help you evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions.
As always, we love to hear from you: Write to us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any article pitches, suggestions or questions. We hope you have a great week!
Mike Allen, CPTM
Editor
[Infographic] Measuring Training Impact: 3 Metrics for Evaluating Success
Learning leaders often face pushback from business stakeholders when implementing new training initiatives. To gain support and be seen as a trusted partner, you have to speak the language of the business. Our 
latest infographic
 outlines three metrics that will help you evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions and prove the impact of training on both learners and the business.
Get the Infographic
 
[E-Book] How Virtual Reality Can Become a Reality for Your Organization
Advances in virtual reality (VR) technology and hardware have made VR a more accessible, affordable and effective option for training programs. Still, some organizations might be held back by a lack of information regarding the tech and anticipated hurdles that come with it. Our new e-book provides data-backed insights on VR’s relevance to L&D, common VR challenges organizations face and tips for overcoming these obstacles. 
Download a preview
 now to learn more.
Download a Preview
 
The 7 Competencies You Need as a Training Manager
Training Industry Courses has identified 
seven competencies
 critical to success, with the most important being the ability to strategically align training to business goals. Our catalog of courses is designed to provide development across all seven competencies, and our research shows that mastery of the competencies is associated with salaries up to $20,000 higher for training professionals. Access 
this guide
 to discover how you can develop the seven competencies you need as a training manager
Access the Guide
 
Leader Talk: Managing Learning Technologies in the Age of AI
Learning leaders are increasingly expected to double as technology experts as learning technologies continue to emerge and evolve at a rapid pace. When you factor in the additional element of AI within these tools, it can be very difficult to know what’s the best fit for your training needs. Join us for this complimentary 
Leader Talk
 
this
 
Thursday, Aug. 10
 to get tips from industry experts on how to leverage and manage AI tools to support your L&D efforts.
Reserve Your Spot
 
STRATEGY, ALIGNMENT AND PLANNING 
AI-Powered Training Logistics: Enhancing Agility and Efficiency
Learn how to leverage AI to streamline logistics, save time and maximize resources for a more agile and successful training function.
Read Now →

Why Upskilling and Reskilling Are Critical to Building a Sustainable and Resilient Workforce
Building a sustainable workforce through upskilling and reskilling is essential to keeping pace with the requirements of dynamic workplaces.

Empower Career Transitions and Drive Retention with Tech Skills Training

How to Train Leaders to Create Psychological Safety
Psychological safety is imperative for team performance: Learn how to train your managers to cultivate it on their teams with these tips.

In this article, we'll review how learning leaders can use training to retain health care support staff in today's labor shortage.
Read Now →
COMPLIANCE 
Mindfulness Goes Virtual: How Companies Are Embracing VR for Mental Health
With VR training, learning leaders can use virtual methods to incorporate mindfulness and mental health practices into their workday.
Read Now →
CONTENT DEVELOPMENT 
Experiential Learning in the Era of Generative AI
Embrace a future of responsible AI development and ethical decision-making through transformative learning experiences.
Read Now →

Does AI Wear Prada? What "The Devil Wears Prada" Can Teach Us About the AI Revolution
"The Devil Wears Prada" can teach us some valuable lessons about the AI revolution — and what it means for L&D.
Read Now →
DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION 
Breaking Barriers: Strategies for Cultivating Inclusion in Virtual Training Sessions
Learn how to cultivate inclusive and effective virtual training sessions with the tips and best practices in this article.
Read Now →
LEARNING SERVICES AND OUTSOURCING 
Partner Enablement — Using Training for Channel Success
Learn how a partner enablement program can equip partners with tailored training, tools, and resources for effective collaboration.
Read Now →

subject: Coolest Thing Made in NC: Nominations now open
body:
What's the coolest thing made in North Carolina? You get to decide!
  
We are excited to announce that nominations for the 
“Coolest Thing Made in NC”
 contest are now open. This statewide contest invites the public to nominate and select the coolest product manufactured in North Carolina. 
  
Nominations will be accepted until August 14.
 The field of nominees will be announced August 24, at which point live voting begins.
Nominate a Product
 
Two categories
:
 
Our contest will recognize two winners: 
one for businesses with fewer than 100 employees, and one for businesses with 100+ employees. Voting for both categories will occur on the same website, with the top vote-getters in each category moving to subsequent rounds of competition.
  
Remember that any product manufactured in North Carolina is eligible for this contest. Company headquarters do not have to be located in North Carolina. You may submit your nomination on the 
contest website
. 
  
We look forward to seeing your nominations roll in. To receive updates about our semifinalists and finalists, you can sign up for alerts below.

subject: Take the pain out of presentations.
body:
Impress your audience using HBR's Good Charts for Persuasive Presentations Set. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS
COLLECTIONS
TOOLS
CASE STUDIES
HBR STORE
 
 
 
Win over your audience
 
 
Today’s business world is data-driven, and the ability to present data in sophisticated charts and graphs is quickly becoming a must-have skill.
Thanks to a new generation of tools, you don’t have to be a professional designer to communicate your ideas. With HBR’s 
Good Charts for Persuasive Presentations Set
, you’ll learn how to win people over with your data visualizations and presentation skills.
 
LEARN MORE
 
In the set:
 
 
Good Charts: HBR Guide to Making Smarter, More Persuasive Data Visualizations
Discover how to powerfully convey ideas that will impress and persuade your audience. 
 
 
 
 
 
Good Charts Workbook: Tips, Tools, and Exercises for Making Better Data Visualizations
Get tools, exercises, and practical insights to help you gain data visualization skills. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations
Polish your presentation skills and become a more confident speaker. Includes a video case study.
 
 
 
 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
Discover more in the HBR Store
Master essential business and leadership skills with books, tools, cases, and more. 
 
SHOP NOW

HBRORGREG4

subject: HBR Survey: Employee Education
body:
Harvard Business Review Analytic Services is conducting research to understand organizations’ use, or lack of use, of tuition assistance programs for employees in the United States. Complete our survey today.
Read online
 
 
Special Invitation 
  
Dear Hannah, 
Many organizations see their people as the company’s most valued asset. Are organizations investing in this asset when it comes to their continued learning? 
Harvard Business Review Analytic Services is conducting 
research
 to understand organizations’ use, or lack of use, of tuition assistance programs for employees in the United States. 
The 
survey
 is available for a limited time. As a thank you, upon completion of the survey, you will be able to download the HBR article, “Where AI Can — and Can’t — Help Talent Management.” In addition, we will post a summary of survey results on HBR.org in the fall. 
COMPLETE THE SURVEY
 
  
Please be assured that your responses are completely confidential and results will be analyzed in the aggregate only. Any personal data will not be used for any purpose other than for the research exercise itself. 
Thank you in advance for participating in this effort. 
Sincerely, 
Alex Clemente
Managing Director, Analytic Services

subject: [Infographic] Measuring Training Impact: 3 Metrics for Evaluating Success
body:
Evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions to prove the impact of training.
View this email  in your browser
Learning and development (L&D) leaders use training metrics to objectively assess the effectiveness of their training programs, make improvements as needed and drive business outcomes. With the right training metrics, they can successfully prove the impact of training to stakeholders and leverage their expertise as a trusted business partner. To prove training success, L&D leaders must first identify what metrics to use in the evaluation process and how to communicate its impact to company leaders.
This infographic
 offers three metrics to help you evaluate the effectiveness of your learning solutions to prove the impact of training and measure learner outcomes.

Find more solutions relevant to your challenges as a training professional. Training Industry's monthly infographics focus on trending topics central to effective L&D.

subject: Augment or Replace? A Modern Learning Approach to Tech, AI and Your People
body:
Check out this session from our upcoming Leader Talk.
View this email  in your browser
You have a learning management system (LMS), a learning experience platform (LXP), a learning content management system (LCMS) and other tools, but you still have questions that the current systems don’t seem to answer. How do you speed up learning and make it more engaging? How do you ensure learning is driving performance? How do you best leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and what should its role be in learning? Should generative AI and ChatGPT be your only focus? 
During this session
 of the Training Industry Leader Talk, Managing Learning Technologies in the Age of AI, attendees will walk away with insights on:
Discovering the technological demands of modern learning and identifying your gaps. 
Augmenting and enhancing your existing tech stack without major disruption. 
Understanding the role and value of AI in modern learning to benefit all stakeholders.
Register now
August 10, 2023 | 11 a.m. - 4 p.m. ET
Register now to attend this session at 3:00 p.m. and any other session during the Training Industry Leader Talk. Can’t attend the live event? Register anyway, and watch the recording when it is available.

subject: Pull back or lean in on DEI?
body:
What should we advise as communicators? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hi 
Hannah.
Ok, it's true that those of us in the U.S. are in the midst of a wave of DEI pushback that's only going to get bigger. Holes are getting poked in our strategies and we're getting stuck between hesitant leaders, employee division, and customer concerns.
I know you're tired of being on the defense. 
I hear that you want to stop being reactive and instead be proactive. It's time we own our space with fortitude.
Let's talk about it. You're invited to attend today's
 special webinar where I'll focus on three key themes emerging given our current climate and what we can do about it.
TODAY: Thurs Aug 3, 10am PT/1pm ET.
REGISTER:
COMMUNICATORS CAUGHT IN THE CULTURE WAR
Even if you can't make it live, register so you get the recording. 
We have some new opportunities that will help you navigate all of this. One is called 
The DEI Communications Blueprint
. 
Another puts you in the driver's seat called 
The DEI Communications LENS Method
 -- the result of 14 years in the making. 
We'll talk about it all at the webinar. See you soon.
kim
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A Podcast Made for You
 
This week's 
Communicate Like You Give a Damn
 episode is part 2 with Kim's mentor, Deborah L. Johnson. 
 
"DEI doesn't have 5 years." 
 
Listen or watch the episode to find out what our guest means and what our call to action is as communicators.

 Kim's 3rd return to Nashville this year, she'll be co-speaking a session with the incredible Anita Ford Saunders at 
PRSA's ICON

Universities!
Bring Kim to your campus this academic year for student, faculty, DEI and Comms teams or events. She has been a lecturer at San Jose State for 20 years and has recently been appointed to serve on the SJSU Campus Committee on DEI. The book she co-authored is designed for communication courses. 
Download Kim's University Speaker Kit

This month we're talking about being habitual. For example, Kim isn't gay just in June during U.S. Pride Month. Let's work on our consistency.

subject: Don’t ignore conflict in the workplace.

Resolve conflict at work
 
 
How can you and your team address conflict professionally and productively—and in a way that improves both your work and your relationships? The

LEARN MORE
 
 
 
You get: 
The

Sample language to use in a variety of conflict situations.

subject: 🎙️ Decoded: New Podcast Release
body:
Join us in unpacking the phrase "I don't see color" with Paul Ladipo from Critical Conversations Consulting, LLC.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
"I don't see color."
“I don’t see color” is sometimes viewed as a non-discriminatory, “politically correct” approach to interactions with people of color. But in reality, there’s a difference between understanding a person’s inherent value and being mindful of the challenges and perspectives each unique identity brings to the conversation.
 
To help us unpack this phrase, Host Larry Baker (he/him) is joined by Paul Ladipo (he/him), who will use their own lived experiences to explain how the phrase actually perpetuates racism through willful ignorance.
Featuring:
 
Paul Ladipo
Founder and Owner
Critical Conversations Consulting, LLC
LinkedIn
 | 
Website

View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WEBINAR: 
'Exploring African Culture'
Your Presenter:
Geremie Sawadago, 
HR Manager, World Bank Group
 
 
 
 
September 13, 2023 @ 11:30 AM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
This webinar will explore
 the rich diversity in African cultures and discuss the case for African cultural unity around six shared cultural values, including: 
(1) communication style; (2) individualism/collectivism; (3) power distance; (4) uncertainty avoidance; (5) polychromic use of time; and (6) long term/short term orientation. 
 Participants will further their knowledge, appreciation and understanding of African cultures and learn tips to effectively communicate and interact with Africans in both a professional and personal context. 
 
Registration = FREE for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
 
Registration = $25.00 for nonmembers
 
NOTE: The registration links shown below have been corrected and will now take you to the September event registration! Apologies for any confusion.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Geremie Sawadago
Geremie Sawadogo is HR Manager at The World Bank Group in Washington DC.
  
Prior to joining the Bank, Geremie was the Country Director for the US Peace Corps in Benin, and he has also taught education and intercultural communication and directed international education programs at universities and community colleges across the US.
  
Geremie is a published 
author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark. 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Geremie Sawadago
Geremie Sawadogo is HR Manager at The World Bank Group in Washington DC.
  
Prior to joining the Bank, Geremie was the Country Director for the US Peace Corps in Benin, and he has also taught education and intercultural communication and directed international education programs at universities and community colleges across the US.
  
Geremie is a published 
author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark.

subject: How do your benefits offerings stack up?
body:
Find out at this free virtual retreat!
 
  
How do your benefits offerings stack up? 
  
  
Knowing what benefits to offer at your organization is a constant struggle. Laws and standards are constantly changing, and employees’ expectations are higher than ever. 
Do you know how your organization’s benefits compare to those at other workplaces?
 The 
SHRM Benefits Trends Virtual Retreat
 on Thursday, Aug. 17, is here to help. 
This virtual retreat takes a deeper look at how employers can keep up with the latest trends in employee benefits. As an HR professional, you know this is critical to 
attracting
, 
engaging
 and 
retaining
 top talent. 
  
  
This 
FREE
 retreat is designed with busy professionals like you in mind. Register for the whole retreat or just a few sessions, depending on what works best for your schedule.
The opening session, 
Exploring Benefits Trends: Strategies to Enhance Your Benefits Package and Gain a Competitive Edge
, is a deep dive on the 
2023 SHRM Employee Benefits Trends Survey
 with 
Johnny C. Taylor, Jr.
, SHRM-SCP, 
Alex Alonso
, Ph.D., SHRM-SCP, and 
Kelly Bliss
. 
The rest of the day offers sessions on 
mental health
, 
child care
, 
providing benefits as a small business
, 
employee financial wellness
, 
menopause
 and 
caring for your employees
, each led by industry experts and thought leaders. 
  
  
SECURE YOUR SPOT TODAY!

subject: The world of work is constantly evolving—are you on top of DE&I trends?
body:
Here’s a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplaces. 
 
 
How can you ensure 
you’re on top of DE&I trends?
INCLUSION 2023
 brings together experts and thousands of HR and DE&I professionals from across industries, so that you can expand your thinking and 
keep pushing positive impact forward in the world of work
. 
Here are a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain 
diverse
, 
equitable
 and 
inclusive
 workplaces. 
 
  
 
Data & Technology will be your distinguisher
 
You need to collect data to 
measure the effectiveness of your DE&I strategy
, but data can be used creatively to ensure you hit your goals. Employee surveys can highlight potential social impact initiatives such as volunteer work and sustainability, 
improving culture
 and 
reducing turnover
 in the long term. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve dedicated an entire content track to 
technology & accessibility
 to help you harness the power of technology while remaining cognizant of employee needs, with sessions like 
ChatGPT: Disruptor or Enabler?
 with 
Carol A. Kiburz, SHRM-SCP
. 
  
  
 
Gender identity will continue to take center stage
 
Words matter, and how employees choose to identify is important for mental health and overall office well-being. It’s 
critical
 that leaders take a pulse on how your organization engages with gender diversity and updates forms and surveys to reflect overall awareness. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve tailored sessions around 
optimizing employee well-being
 at every level, with sessions like 
WORDS MATTER: The Case for Inclusive Communication Across Generations
 with 
Joy Johnson-Carruthers
. 
  
  
 
Invest in Leadership
 
Outdated leadership programs will continue to be overhauled and rebuilt to emphasize DE&I strategy and 
maximize employee retention
. Employees are no longer impressed with old-guard leadership tactics—your approach must be 
authentic
 and 
transparent
 in order to build trust and maximize engagement. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve built our programming to 
maximize leadership potential
 and 
invest in DE&I strategy
, with sessions like 
The Three Big Chasms of New Diverse Leadership
 with 
Guillermo Mendoza
. 
  
 
Don’t fall behind on DE&I trends
. Join thousands of your peers and industry experts at 
INCLUSION 2023
 this 
Oct. 30 - Nov. 1
 in 
Savannah, Ga
. Last year this conference sold out so don’t delay and 
secure your seat today
! 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
  
CHECK OUT THIS 
PRECONFERENCE OPPORTUNITY 
  
 
 
 
Inclusive Workplace Culture:
Leading and Sustaining a Culture Transformation
* 
 
John Baldino
 
SHRM-SCP, MSHR, SPHR 
 
Numerous research studies conﬁrm that diverse workforces lead in innovation, productivity and proﬁtability. The key to unlocking these organizational benefits is to...

subject: Celebrating 100 years of HBR!
body:
There has never been a better time to add HBR to your tool chest ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
Now is the time to be thinking about where you want to go professionally in the new year.
Maybe your goals center around improving your skills in a specific area, such as technology, decision making, or problem solving. Or perhaps your goals are focused on improving your leadership skills and stepping into a new management position.
HBR has the articles, insights, and research that today’s professionals need to make it a great year.
Get unlimited article access when you subscribe to HBR. 
LEARN MORE
 
Read some of our recent articles:
38 Smart Questions to Ask in a Job Interview
The Power of Work Friends
A Better Way to Recognize Your Employees
How to Recover from a Toxic Job
How to Give a Killer Presentation

The summer is a great time to learn and grow, and prepare for your

Through August 6, all upcoming virtual SHRM instructor-led courses are 20% off when you use code VCP20 at checkout.*

subject: Coolest Thing Made in NC: Nominations now open
body:
What's the coolest thing made in North Carolina? You get to decide!
  
We are excited to announce that nominations for the 
“Coolest Thing Made in NC”
 contest are now open. This statewide contest invites the public to nominate and select the coolest product manufactured in North Carolina. 
  
Nominations will be accepted until August 14.
 The field of nominees will be announced August 24, at which point live voting begins.
Nominate a Product
 
Two categories
:
 
Our contest will recognize two winners: 
one for businesses with fewer than 100 employees, and one for businesses with 100+ employees. Voting for both categories will occur on the same website, with the top vote-getters in each category moving to subsequent rounds of competition.
  
Remember that any product manufactured in North Carolina is eligible for this contest. Company headquarters do not have to be located in North Carolina. You may submit your nomination on the 
contest website
. 
  
We look forward to seeing your nominations roll in. To receive updates about our semifinalists and finalists, you can sign up for alerts below.

subject: 2023 DI-NC Fall Conference:  "Great Leaders Create Great Culture"
body:
2023 DI-NC Fall Conference: "Great leaders Create Great Cultures"
 
 
2023 DI-NC Fall Conference:
“ Great Leaders Create Great Cultures”
 
 
August is here and planning for the 2023 Fall Conference is underway. 
The theme for the conference is:
"Great Leaders Create Great Cultures".
When:
 
Oct. 12, 2023
Where: Trane Technologies,
Davidson, NC. 
﻿
Time: 9:00 AM to 4:00PM
The conference will focus
 on how leaders who support disability inclusion create cultures that embrace diversity and innovation.
 
 
Our Keynote Speaker this year is 
Holly Riddle.
 As former Executive Director for the North Carolina Council on Developmental Disabilities, Holly led the state in the establishment of innovative employment services for people with disabilities that pioneered the disability employment movement through the expansion of post-secondary opportunities for college students with disabilities. 
Currently Holly is a policy advisor with the NC Department of Health and Human Services and the author of "What to Make of Managed Care: Its Impact on Direct Support Professionals and the People They Support." Holly also leads the Olmstead Plan Development for the NC Department of Health and Human Services as an Assistant Director in their Office of the Senior Advisor of the ADA. She is a former member of the American Bar Association's Commission on Mental and Physical Disability Law; a member of the National Advisory Board for the College of Direct Support and former chair of the American Association on Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities' Legal Process and Advocacy Committee. 
 
 
John Robinson, 
Managing Partner and CEO of
 
Our Ability 
will join Holly as a guest keynote. 
Our Ability, 
uses artificial intelligence to help Job seekers with disabilities find better employment opportunities. DI-NC member/sponsors are connecting with qualified job seekers with disabilities from across the world using the Our Ability jobs portal. 
Registration will open August 15, 2023 at DI-NC.org
Disability:IN North Carolina | Sponsors and Members
Founding Program Sponsors
 
 
Special Thanks to Wells Fargo for their multi-year sponsorship of CommunAbility:DI-NC with 
Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) across North Carolina! 
 
 
We are grateful to Healthy Blue NC for becoming our founding partner to expand apprenticeship programs 
﻿
for people with disabilities.

subject: Reminder: Ask Me TOMORROW
body:
Tues Aug 1st is our next meetup! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Hi there. Here's your reminder to make time for Ask Me tomorrow. Why?
 
Well, it's turned into quite the sh*tshow in the DEI space since we last met for Ask Me Anything DEI Communications. I'm sure you have questions...how will this climate impact companies, what can we do, etc. Good questions. That's what this monthly space is for. 
 
Come with your questions or submit them in advance:

See you soon.

subject: An Absolutely Amazing, Simple Group Icebreaker
body:
Best no-cringe connection activity
View this email  in your browser
Have you had the experience of being in a group setting and hearing that dreaded sentence: “
Before we begin, let’s do an icebreaker!
”? 
Did your stomach automatically sink just reading that? It doesn’t have to be that way.
There are three things your icebreaker needs to be in order for your audience to enjoy it. ​​​​​​
 
Non-threatening
Inviting
Full of choice for your audience
In 
today’s video
, I’m going to give you one of my absolute favorite connection exercises that fulfills all three of those criteria AND will actually be enjoyable for your group.
This exercise uses 
We! Engage Cards
 
… which you’d love if you don’t already have them. You’ll also find a 
free, printable sample of the deck
 on our resources page. 
 
This exercise is great for new groups OR groups that have worked together for 10 years. And, just for fun, I share three different variations on that icebreaker so you can shake things up at every meeting. (See – it’s already fulfilling characteristic #3)
 
 
Access Free Card Deck
Toward 
real
 connection — online and off,
CHAD LITTLEFIELD
Creator of the
 
Connection Toolkit
Co-Founder, Author & Speaker at 
We and Me
 
Training Industry, Inc. 
110 Horizon Drive, Suite 110
Raleigh, NC 27615-6520
