subject: Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
WEBINAR
 
July 11: Attract Loyal Hourly Workers by Diversifying Your Sourcing Strategy
Job boards are slowly becoming a thing of the past. Applicants use them to apply to multiple jobs at once—rather than to find the job they’re really excited about. To increase your chances of hiring hourly workers who are more likely to stick around, you need to implement a diverse, active sourcing strategy. Join industry expert Jackie Adams, to learn the top strategies businesses can employ to increase applicant quality and build a stronger hourly workforce. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 19: Innovation in Family Health: How Companies Can Take Personalized Approach 
Family health has taken on new dimensions over the past few years, as employers have recognized that in geographically distributed workplaces, employees face different circumstances when it comes to the availability and quality of fertility care, pediatric care, child care, education, and after-school programming. How can companies invested in family-friendly and caregiving benefits adapt to the variety of needs in their workforces? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 26: The New Keys to Employee Satisfaction, Recognition, and Retention
The right combination of total rewards, career advancement, and corporate purpose has been a moving target in recent years as workers reconsider their priorities. How can companies accentuate the benefits of sticking with  their organizations, emphasizing factors including personal growth, fulfillment, and benefits tailored to their individual needs? Which tools can accurately measure employee satisfaction, and how can managers augment their effect? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 3: 
How the Definition of Total Rewards Is Changing
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 8: Filling the Gaps in Your Healthcare Benefits to Make Them More Inclusive
To provide personalized medical-benefit plans for an increasingly diverse workforce, employers need to find the shortcomings in their offerings and explore innovative ways to fix them. Workers today have higher expectations when it comes to employer support for family-building, wellness, and mental health. What kind of surveys and other tools can companies use to assess the needs of their workforce? In a marketplace with many point solutions, how can employers find the right mix for their workers? From the POV of the employees, what are the most inclusive ways to help them navigate the complex healthcare system? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 9: The Changing Profile of HR Leaders: How the Role Is Evolving and Growing
In just the past two years, HR has risen to the C-suite level in influence and responsibility. How should HR leaders respond in terms of preparing for changing roles, managing their new duties, and charting their own career paths? What can HR leaders do to leverage their new prominence to make change happen across the whole organization? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
August 17: When Belonging Is Broken: How an Intervention Can Strengthen Your Organization’s Culture
When a company has a healthy culture of belonging, it reaps many benefits: high performance, highly engaged employees, psychological safety, and the freedom to be authentic. But many organizations drift into the opposite condition. They suffer from ineffective practices for diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI). One of the symptoms is inadvertently excluding some in an attempt to include others. How can companies recognize when they need an intervention? What steps should they take to reverse the syndrome–and who should manage the process? What will it look like when they embed belonding at the team and organizational level? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
September 12: Boston, Massachusetts
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 19: Ageism in Industries
Ageism remains the open secret in the advertising, marketing and branding categories. Subtle discrimination is vaguely disguised in commercials and employer branding, especially in the beauty and tech industries. Often times the About Us and Meet our Team landing pages can tell you more about a brand than the nicely polished imagery. If you’re an organization that struggles to attract and retain experienced talent, join AARP Sr Advisor Heather Tinsley-Fix and New & Improved Principal Lisa Balser for a discussion on how ageism shows up in marketing and how employers can signal and implement a more inclusive culture. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 20: Building A Healthy Work Environment to Persevere Through Multiple Challenges
Organizations offering health care and wellness benefits maintain a stronger sense of employee loyalty. Yet health and well-being among employees goes beyond acute or specific physical or mental health needs. How can companies create a culture that emphasizes health through everyday experience? What are the hidden opportunities to nurture this kind of culture? Rather than relying only on standard  benefits to respond in times of unexpected distress, how can organizations address employee needs proactively? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
September 26: Manhattan, New York
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 27: Giving Workers Direction About Skills and Career Development
Many workers yearn to grow and advance in their careers, yet don’t have an understanding of how to develop their skills and experience  for a role with more responsibility. Learning and  development can help not only by showing the many possibilities, but also with vision to help employees find the learning and development path that will enable the most fulfilling growth according to their own interests. What can organizations do to deploy coaching in a way that helps not only with short-term goals but also the long arc of a worker’s career? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 3: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
October 10: Why Women’s Health Benefits are Essential to Retention, Affordability
Women’s health can be a high cost driver for employers. Additionally, offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But, women’s health in general is not just one condition. Join us for this fireside chat where Ovia Health Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Leslie Saltzman, explains the different facets of women’s health (like menopause, fertility, maternity care management, etc.), what areas generate the most ROI and how employers can offer the deepest, and most all-encompassing benefits to support and delight their employees and medically supported dependents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
October 11: How HR Technology Can Connect, Motivate, and Recognize the Hybrid Workforce
Most workers have strongly embraced hybrid and remote work arrangements, having settled into sustainable routines that allow them to be productive. But camaraderie and a sense of belonging have proven elusive without meaningful face-to-face contact and team-building opportunities. How can organizations create new structures for in-person gatherings that maintain the comfort of remote or hybrid work, as well as new digital approaches that create the ties that bind? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 18: Denver, Colorado
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 2: Los Angeles, California
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
November 8: Casting a Wider Net: Fresh, Productive Approaches to Diversity Recruiting
Many companies fall short of their diversity-hiring goals because they keep looking in the same places–and with the same techniques and expectations. What are the best ways for employers to break out of these patterns? How can they reconsider their job specifications to bring in more non-traditional candidates and prospects who could thrive with a modest amount of training and upskilling? What are the new and innovative ways to strengthen a diverse pipeline? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
November 9: Bridging the Distance: How Tech Can Boost Engagement and Recognition
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 14: Miami, Florida
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
December 13: The Arc of Change for People and Culture in 2024
Recent history affirms that unpredictable events will buffet the workplace of 2024, yet the trajectory of trends in 2023 gives an indication of how organizations will need to be ready for changing expectations among workers and other stakeholders. What are the emerging patterns that leaders should watch in the realms of diversity and inclusion, talent acquisition, employee rewards, learning and development, social responsibility and sustainability? What new points of focus will arrive in the greater field of people and culture? 
Register now
.

subject: Laying the Groundwork for Upskilling: Blueprints for Engagement and Performance Wins
body:
Check out the opening session from our upcoming Training Industry Leader Talk.
View this email  in your browser
There’s a talent shortage, and organizations everywhere are tightening budgets. However, companies still need to drive engagement and performance, so filling skill gaps in their existing teams has become a necessity. Whether your organization is focused on targeted skill development or a broader initiative, there are plans you can put in place today to see big successes with a limited team. 
During this session
 of the Training Industry Leader Talk on Upskilling and Reskilling for the Future of Your Workforce, attendees will learn best practices on:
Determining where the skills gaps are in their organization.
Identifying success criteria.
Building out a skills development program.
Real-life examples of upskilling successes.
Register now
July 20, 2023 | 11 a.m. - 2:45 p.m. E.T.
Register now to attend this session at 11:00 a.m. and any other session during the Training Industry Leader Talk. Can’t attend the live event? Register anyway, and watch the recording when it is available.

subject: ✉️ You're Invited! Learning with LCW Webinar
body:
Reserve your seat for our July Learning with LCW webinar: Creating a Culture of Inclusion that Fosters High Performance.
 
Learning with LCW Webinar
Reserve Your Seat
 
In the last three years, organizations have taken unprecedented steps to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging in their organizations. Have their efforts been successful? Creating impact that is both measurable and sustainable is both the most vital and most difficult aspect of DEIB work as well as of culture work more broadly.
 
LCW’s Sustainable Culture of Inclusion (SCI) Model serves as a framework for understanding organizational maturity. LCW believes that the cultural diversity inherent in all organizations is an asset that can be leveraged to build high performance, and that sustainable cultures of inclusion are the foundation for this success. Ultimately, the goal is to create a Sustainable Culture of Inclusion that produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for employees.
In this session, we will:
Share the genesis & structure of the SCI Model
Discuss how we use the SCI model to diagnose organizations’ current state
Provide two case studies that demonstrate the model’s impact 
Facilitated by:
 
 
Sarah Nodarse
Principal Consultant, LCW
 
 
Vince Bongiovanni
Associate Consultant, LCW
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 LCW, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

subject: Learn what the numbers really mean.
body:
If you’re not a “numbers person,” HBR’s Financial Intelligence Set is for you. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS
COLLECTIONS
TOOLS
CASE STUDIES
HBR STORE
 
 
 
Conquer your fear of finance
 
 
HBR’s 
Financial Intelligence Set: What You Need to Know to Succeed
 will enable you to mine every bit of meaning from the financial reports that cross your desk, employ financial techniques that can multiply your effectiveness, and foresee business opportunities that remain invisible to others. If you’re not a “numbers person,” this collection is the way to learn what you’ve always needed to know.
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
In the collection:
 
 
HBR Guide to Finance Basics for Managers Ebook + Tools
 provides the fundamentals of financial literacy, offering tips on reading and deciphering financial statements, preparing a breakeven analysis, how to speak the language of ROI, and more.
 
 
 
 
 
Financial Intelligence: A Manager's Guide to Knowing What the Numbers Really Mean
 lays the foundation for a deep understanding of the financial side of business and arms managers with practical strategies for improving performance. 
 
 
 
 
 
How Finance Works
 uses entertaining case studies, interactive exercises, full-color visuals, and a conversational style to show how finance really works. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Tools: EBITDA
 (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, Amortization) will help you master the key concepts of EBITDA, whether you’re a finance novice or just need a refresher. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Guide to Data Analytics for Managers Ebook + Tools
 will help managers tease insight from data to understand where it comes from, make sense of the numbers, and use those findings to inform decisions. 
 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
Discover more tools
Master finance skills with more books, collections, and tools. Learn more today.
 
SHOP NOW
 
 
To redeem, simply enter 
HBRORGREG4
 in the Promotional Code field at checkout. Discount will be applied to your order subtotal of your first purchase only.

Purchasers are responsible for all shipping charges, duties, taxes, brokerage fees, and/or import fees imposed by the country of import.

subject: Canceled: Q2 Learner's Lounge
body:
Welcome to the LCW Learner’s Lounge!
 
Professional Development Series:
 LCW Learner’s Lounge
Q2 Reading Material:
 
Learning in Relationship:
 Foundation for Personal and Professional Success by Ronald R. Short.
Audience:
 All employees, participation is optional but strongly suggested
Format:
 There will be 5-6 meetings, every 2 weeks, and we’ll read roughly 10-20 pages per meeting (the book is under 200 pages).
 
Learning in Relationships
 is very actionable with s
pecific maps, methods, and models to put into immediate use and 
prepares readers
 to respond to the following truths:
Communicating is not about doing it right the first time. It is about learning from each other especially when communications go wrong.
The information we need to learn is always present, all the time, always here and now.
The book starts with a series of short thinking lessons that help the reader locate the source of the communication problem not within the other person, but inside oneself. 
The book then puts the reader--not the other person(s)--in charge, knowing that abstract organizations don't change, only individuals change. . . who then work together to make changes in their specific relationship and organization.
As with the first Learner’s Lounge, this meeting is optional but strongly suggested. Of course, we encourage the opportunity to learn and grow in our communication, leadership development, and anti-racist practices. As Sarah mentioned before, we want LCW to be an organization that practices what we preach. We hope you will find time to read the book with a focus on introspection and reflection and are happy to keep the option
 
to organize a 1:1 with a staff member if you wish to have an individual thought partner in processing it or can’t make the meetings and would still like to discuss the book.

subject: Canceled: Q2 Learner's Lounge
body:
Welcome to the LCW Learner’s Lounge!
 
Professional Development Series:
 LCW Learner’s Lounge
Q2 Reading Material:
 
Learning in Relationship:
 Foundation for Personal and Professional Success by Ronald R. Short.
Audience:
 All employees, participation is optional but strongly suggested
Format:
 There will be 5-6 meetings, every 2 weeks, and we’ll read roughly 10-20 pages per meeting (the book is under 200 pages).
 
Learning in Relationships
 is very actionable with s
pecific maps, methods, and models to put into immediate use and 
prepares readers
 to respond to the following truths:
Communicating is not about doing it right the first time. It is about learning from each other especially when communications go wrong.
The information we need to learn is always present, all the time, always here and now.
The book starts with a series of short thinking lessons that help the reader locate the source of the communication problem not within the other person, but inside oneself. 
The book then puts the reader--not the other person(s)--in charge, knowing that abstract organizations don't change, only individuals change. . . who then work together to make changes in their specific relationship and organization.
As with the first Learner’s Lounge, this meeting is optional but strongly suggested. Of course, we encourage the opportunity to learn and grow in our communication, leadership development, and anti-racist practices. As Sarah mentioned before, we want LCW to be an organization that practices what we preach. We hope you will find time to read the book with a focus on introspection and reflection and are happy to keep the option
 
to organize a 1:1 with a staff member if you wish to have an individual thought partner in processing it or can’t make the meetings and would still like to discuss the book.

Training professionals need to excel in a variety of competencies in order to be successful in developing relevant and impactful training that supports your organization's strategic goals. To help understand this complex and critical role, we've organized the most important competencies into the

subject: How can you manage different generations effectively?
body:
The one thing you need to know to manage across generations.
 
 
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Have you ever had direct reports who are significantly older or more experienced than you?
  
Or had to manage people who are much younger and seemed to be on a different wavelength?
  
If so, you’ll appreciate that managing across generations can be tricky, and filled with challenges around power dynamics, communication styles, and points of reference.
  
But while there are undoubtedly some pitfalls to navigate, most people make intergenerational management much more difficult than it needs to be. I know I did for many years.
  
But then I made a discovery that changed everything.
  
It’s such a simple concept that I can’t believe it didn’t occur to me sooner, but since I started implementing it, it has completely transformed how I manage people from generations that came to the workforce before and after me.
  
It's easy to learn, quick to implement, and you can 
read all about it here.
 
Have a motivating day!
 
Casey
Casey Wahl
Founder & CEO
P.S. Want to know more about how Attuned can help you improve communication and increase motivation? 
Take a tour!
 
P.P.S. Want even more in-depth insights? Download our free White Papers on 
Extrinsic Motivation vs Intrinsic Motivation
, 
Psychological Safety in the Hybrid Work Era
, and 
The Power of the Nudge
, as well as our data-and-infographic-packed 
The State of Motivation Report 2023
.
 
If this was forwarded to you, subscribe here!

subject: The future is bright! ✨
body:
LCW adopts a new visual identity to celebrate a renewed commitment to clients for the next 20 years.
 
LCW's New Visual Identity
Dear Hannah, 
We’re excited to announce that the LCW you’ve trusted with cultural competence, diversity, equity, and inclusion for the past 20 years is getting a contemporary new look to celebrate our reenergized commitment to our clients for the next 20 years! 
 
Our new visual identity very intentionally balances our heritage with our dedication to the future of cultural competence. The bright and energizing color palette complement our signature LCW blue to capture the energy and modern innovation we bring to our clients each day, and the new interconnected ribbon motif represents a convergence of identities, experiences, and ideas on our unending journey toward changing mindsets and systems.
 
LCW remains your partner for sustained, long-term transformation and impact as we seek to build a sustainable culture of inclusion throughout each organization with which we work. Bolstered by 20 years of global experience, we’re eager to take the next step forward together into a bold, new future.
Sincerely,
Team LCW
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

subject: Hannah, could we be a perfect match?
body:
View in browser
 
Inside look: partnering with us.
 
Hannah
, 
we know how hard it is to plan, run, and measure DEI initiatives.
Learn More
 
There are a million and one different aspects to consider, senior leaders to engage, and areas of development to choose between. Not to mention all the meetings and emails. (And the fact you’ve got other projects on your plate too.)
 
Sometimes, managing all this complexity makes it near impossible to get started – let alone spark tangible change within your organisation. If that sounds a little familiar, then we’ve got some good news. 
As your partner, we clear up the complexity that all too easily clouds progress.
 
We can help you at every stage:
 from identifying and diagnosing your challenges through to designing and managing the right programme for your needs. (Even collecting the data and measuring success.)
 
We’ve attached our brochure 
here
, hopefully it’ll shed some light on the way we do things, and how we get results.
And if you'd like to chat about partnering up, send us an email
Get in touch
 
 
OUR STORY
 
WHY US?
 
OUR PEOPLE
 
When your people thrive, so does your business.
 
 
 
The full name of our company is Talking Talent Ltd. We are registered in England & Wales under registration number 05617899. Our registered address is Talking Talent Ltd, 102 Crowmarsh Battle Barns, Preston Crowmarsh, Oxfordshire OX10 6SL

subject: Time Is Ticking … Register for the Training Needs Assessment Certificate Today
body:
Conquer your needs assessment fears once and for all.
View this email in your browser
.
If you struggle to identify pressing business needs and determine how training can (or can’t) solve them, 
you are not alone.
Of the seven core responsibilities of a training manager, identified in our 
Training Manager Competency Model
, training managers rate their own ability to perform a needs analysis as one of their weakest … but also as one of the most important responsibilities of their role.
We created the 
Training Needs Assessment Certificate
 program to address this gap and equip training managers with the tools, templates and skills to perform effective training needs assessments.
There’s still time to register for the next session happening

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 July 2, 2023
body:
Summer issue of Training Industry Magazine, new podcast episode and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
“When change hits, our job begins,” said Sandy Ogg, founder at CEO.works and closing keynote at the Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE). This past week, more than 600 learning leaders gathered to connect and share ideas on how to prepare their people and organizations to move at the pace of change. From inspiring keynotes and breakout sessions to roundtable discussions and networking opportunities, the energy and passion of our training community left me feeling optimistic for the future of learning and development (L&D).
During TICE, we also recognized the authors behind our 20 most-read articles of the year at the 
Training Industry Readership and Editors' Awards
 luncheon. Congratulations to all the winners and thank you to everyone who contributes content to Training Industry.
I hope that you find the resources in this newsletter helpful as you kick off the third quarter and continue executing your learning strategy. As always, we love hearing from you. Please email us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Michelle Eggleston Schwartz, CPTM
Editor in Chief 
Hot off the Press: Training Industry Magazine’s Summer Issue
The Summer 2023 issue of Training Industry Magazine is out now! It's up to L&D to prepare organizations for the increasing pace of change; but first, we need to align our goals and how to measure them. This edition includes articles on developing a performance-first mindset, giving better feedback, bridging the digital skills gap, designing employee competency rubrics and more. Check it out now!
Read Now
 
The Business of Learning, Episode 65: The Employee Experience — What’s L&D Got to Do With It?
For many training professionals, creating a culture of learning sits on the long list of “nice-to-haves.” So, in our latest podcast episode, we turned to the pros for tips on integrating learning into the employee experience: We spoke with Sydney Savion, senior director of learning services at Google and member of Training Industry Magazine’s editorial board, Thomas Fenstermacher, CPTM, learning specialist at TrellisRX, and Eric McArdle, CPTM, manager of training and knowledge management at Cisco. 
Listen Now
 
Research Sale on State of the Industry Reports and E-Books
From what learners really want to current trends across market segments, Training Industry research has over 15 years of market data to help inform your training strategy. We provide data-driven analysis and best practices for L&D by capturing the perspectives of learning professionals, learners and training companies across a wide array of industries. Save 25% on all reports and e-books with code 
RESEARCH25
. Hurry, sale ends July 5!
Save Now
 
LEADERSHIP 
5 Leadership Skills All Employees Need to Thrive
Employees at all levels would benefit from leadership training on soft skills like adaptability, emotional intelligence and more.
Read Now →

How to Leverage Training to Improve the Employee Experience
Learn how to leverage training to build connections, improve job satisfaction, and enhance overall well-being in the workplace.
Read Now →
LEARNING TECHNOLOGIES 
5 Reasons to Implement Digital Escape Rooms Into Your Training Programs
Digital escape rooms are an exciting way to engage and motivate employees to learn. Learn more in this article.
Read Now →
ONBOARDING 
Creating a Culture of Trust for More Impactful Remote Onboarding
In this article, we’ll review seven helpful keys to creating a culture of trust for a remote employee onboarding program.
Read Now →
CONTENT DEVELOPMENT 
3 Ways to Enhance Training With Social Elements
Social learning can improve learner engagement and retention, while also building connection among dispersed team members.
Read Now →
MEASUREMENT AND ANALYTICS 
Evaluating the Effectiveness of Skills Transfer in the Workplace: Part 2
In this article, we’ll review some assessment methods for evaluating the effectiveness of skills retention and transfer in the workplace.
Read Now →
CONTENT DEVELOPMENT 
L&D for Gen Z: Meeting the Needs of the Newest Generation
Explore Gen Z's preferred learning methods and how companies can attract and engage this generation through effective L&D strategies.
Read Now →
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT 
Career Pathways in L&D: A Journey From Teaching to Training
This article outlines one training manager's career path, which began in education before she transitioned into a corporate training role.
Read Now →

subject: What brings you here Hannah?
body:

Tell us how we can help.
 
A bit about us
 
Here at Talking Talent, 
we're committed to making the working world better for everyone
. Our business psychologists, accredited coaches and diversity leaders – plus our project managers and client support teams – have a combination of lived experience and deep expertise. Meaning they're the safest pair of hands to guide your organisation through its DEI journey.  
 
Whether it's identifying development areas, assessing (or creating) strategies and initiatives, enhancing leadership capabilities, facilitating safe dialogues, or helping your diverse talent progress into senior roles, we can help.
  
Here's a snapshot of some of the organisations we work with: 
 
Read more about our client work
 
 
OUR STORY
 
WHY US?
 
OUR PEOPLE
 
When your people thrive, so does your business.

subject: Reminder: Bravery in Action: Championing and Crafting Spaces for LGBTQ+ Individuals starts in 1 hour
body:
Hi Hannah Strack,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 hour: 
Bravery in Action
:
 Championing and Crafting Spaces for LGBTQ+ Individuals
Date & Time
Jun 30, 2023 01:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
Webinar ID
876 3529 4697
Passcode
Inclusion1
Description
Join us on Friday, June 30 for Bravery in Action: Crafting and Championing Inclusive Spaces for LGBTQ+ Individuals. This is a #BE365 virtual panel discussion hosted by Be Equitable, a mid-size IDEA consultancy with over thirty years of experience partnering with organizations to advance inclusion, diversity, equity, and accessibility in the workplace and in the world. Our BE team members will delve into the history and contemporary issues affecting LGBTQ+ individuals in the workplace and our communities. Through personal narratives and engaging roundtable conversations, participants will explore the power of allyship in transforming our workspaces and fostering a sense of belonging for all.
The panel discussion is scheduled from 1-2PM ET with an extended community discussion until 2:30PM ET.
Our values guide our work at BE Equitable. Our differences are celebrated by showing up as our authentic selves and embracing the journey. The #BE365 initiative is purposed to celebrate, educate, and highlight feature cultural moments, underrepresented voices throughout the year.
If you are interested in learning more about our BE upcoming events be sure to follow us on LinkedIn (be-equitable) and Instagram (be.equitable) or visit us at www.be-equitable.com.

subject: 🎙️ Podcast Release: AANHPI Heritage Month
body:
Maya Hu-Chan joins the podcast to deconstruct myths and microaggressions faced by the AANHPI community.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
AANHPI History and Allyship
Since 1992, May has been recognized as Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month in the United States. So how can we honor the lived experiences of this diverse community and show up as authentic allies coming out of a pandemic that increased anti-Asian hate crimes and discrimination?
 
In this episode of 
Brave Conversations with LCW
, Host 
Larry Baker
 (he/him) is joined by internationally recognized keynote speaker, best-selling author, and master-certified executive coach 
Maya Hu-Chan
 (she/her). Together, they defined allyship through deconstructing myths and microaggressions faced by the AANHPI community, today and throughout history.
 
The episode was live streamed on Monday, May 22.
Featuring:
 
 
Maya Hu-Chan
Founder and President
Global Leadership Associates
Website

Only one day remains to get substantial savings on the one and only Sales Comp’23 August 21-23 in Chicago! Claim your spot now for this vibrant gathering of your professional community, where you’ll learn up-to-the-minute strategies for building — and retaining — top-notch sales teams that outperform their markets. For three energizing days, you’ll network and share solutions with peers and providers with expertise in sales analytics, operations, and compensation. 
 
 
 
 
Don't let the clock expire on our best registration rates
 
. Register before the clock runs out, 
Friday, June 30,
 and you can save up to $300 on our regular rates for Sales Comp’23. Your conference learnings and connections will long endure, but these savings won’t last! Act now to inspire, empower and accelerate phenomenal sales performance at THE sales-comp event of the year! 
 
 
 
Sign Me Up Now To Save 
New Sessions Released!
 
Sales Comp’23 offers a full program of interactive sessions across three cutting-edge tracks—Sales Compensation, Sales Analytics and Sales Operations—so you can customize your experience to align with your own goals and interests. You won’t get an experience like this anywhere else.
 
The transformational just-added sessions include: 
 
Time for Sales Compensation to Catch up with Today's Reality of the B2B Seller
 
Everything is changing around the seller except their compensation plans. The economy is more unpredictable than ever, with industries pivoting to new strategies overnight based on innovations like Generative AI. Prospecting is no longer effective with sixty-five percent of buyers relying on their own research to determine when to purchase. Buying cycle engagement is trackable, with over eighty percent of their interactions available to be captured and analyzed. It’s time for sales compensation leaders to adapt to this changing environment and use it to drive results from their compensation investment. This session will present three things every organization needs to do to make this a reality.
Speaker:
Seth Marrs: 
Principal Analyst at Forrester
Is Your House Built 
On
 Sand? Examining Your SPM Foundations
 
Do you find yourself constantly redoing plans and infrastructure hoping for better insights, plan alignment and an engaged sales team? But it never seems enough? Many companies continue to throw technology and resources at the problem with little ROI. In reality, they should be examining the inadequate foundations their SPM operations were built upon. Learn how a Fortune 50 company did exactly 
that and achieved spectacular outcomes for their bottom line.

subject: Notes from the road: Pride Month
body:
And a big announcement about a new way to learn DEI communications ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
Hi 
Hannah.
 
Whew. A lot has happened since we last connected. Let's catch up...
Pride Month 2023 is historical. Starting with the over 550 anti-LGBTQ+ bills in play in the U.S., Uganda's new law that includes the death penalty for 'aggravated homosexuality', Texas' governor closing DEI offices at Universities.
Then there's Bud Light, Target and Starbucks to name a few examples of how much companies need The DEPTH Model to do better. Think of the money, time, reputation, frustrations, meetings, and cyclical discussions spent when it could have been avoided by The DEPTH Model. When will we learn?
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Being on the road in several cities this month, Toronto was the most visibly supportive of Pride. Everywhere one looked downtown, there was some signage, story, or statement. 
Some messaging still needed some work, like the window cling that said Everyone Deserves Pizza at a pizza restaurant. Access to pizza isn't what the Stonewall riots in 1969 were fighting for. Pizza doesn't keep me and my community members safe and alive. But I appreciate the acknowledgment. 
While I was in Nashville, I met with folks who are directly impacted by the rhetoric and actions taking place. Pride events had to increase security and yet the resolve and commitment to show up and tell our stories is inspiring. There's a southern tenacity that is palpable. 
We need many more allies showing up and speaking up though. We didn't create this situation and we can't fix it alone. Don't let the work be only ours to carry, ok?
The significance of Pride and Juneteenth in the same month is not lost on me. Both are about liberation. LGBTQ+ folks wouldn't have the rights that we have without the Civil Rights Act. Pride was started by trans women of color such as Marsha P. Johnson, Sylvia Rivera, Miss Major Griffin-Gracy, and Storm
é
 DeLarverie. We can't lose sight that the most vulnerable among us fought - and still fight - the hardest.
What we say and do personally shows up in the work we do professionally 
I also visited the Nashville Juneteenth Festival. As a white person, I was a guest. I think it's important for people like me and those who look like me to learn about and have the experience of being a guest of other communities when we're allowed and invited (and not centered). 
When invited, Christians going to other faith events, heterosexual folks going to Pride, white folks at Juneteenth, and men going to women's conferences are all instrumental opportunities to appreciate the joy, authenticity, and beauty of communities we aren't a part of. Be a guest and listen. It's all right there if we're paying attention. 
These opportunities inform how we communicate cultural moments and movements, the stories we tell, and the lens through which we see and experience the world and its people. 
Good work is happening...and there's more work to do
Thank you to the several clients who brought me in for sessions: 
Women in Defense San Diego
Institute for Food Technologists
Sims Ltd. 
Irdeto 
iDEIntity #changemakers
IABC Philadelphia
IABC (International Association of Business Communications) gave me space at World Conference 
IMCA (Insurance Marketing Communications Association) gave me the main stage
Thank you for the space to have productive, tough, and real conversations, and for prioritizing this conversation for your members and employees. 
I had the honor to meet hundreds of people from all over the world this month. People shared with me the fear they feel for their trans kid - I invite any leader who is stalling on DEI efforts to tell this mom that DEI isn't a priority amongst "competing priorities". 
Friends, there's nothing fluffy or "soft" about DEI. It's about real lives, real people, real impact. 
I listened to stories of frustration with leaders and stakeholders not taking meaningful action, and people looking to leave because of organizational inaction.
One point I made during one of my talks was that organizations choosing inertia as their DEI strategy may think they aren't causing any harm...but that's not at all true. 
Inaction is causing a lot of harm. I'll write more about that another time but know that there are options. We don't have to keep stuck in this. There's a tremendous world waiting on the other side of our yes. 
Write a post it for your monitor: "Kim is not gay just in June"
This is the last week of Pride Month 2023 in the U.S. Remember the last C of the 3Cs of Cultural Moments: Consistency. Stay on it and don't let up. 
So, how do you feel about your participation this year? How has your organization protected and liberated LGBTQ+, Black, and African American communities this month? Be honest. 
Set up time with me
 and let's talk about it. 
Thanks to all who stood for us and didn't waver. For those who celebrate 4th of July in the U.S., let's keep doing the work so 
everyone can be free.
 Today. Now. Thanks.
- kim
PS: 
See the big announcement
 I shared yesterday plus heads up -- see below on a change of date for July's Ask Me Anything. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
BIG NEWS! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We launched a new podcast made just for you. 
 
T
he brand new weekly podcast where we explore the communicator's role and responsibility in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) work.
Listen, Subscribe, Share Now

subject: Remain competitive in an AI world.
body:
Get up to speed on the latest research and intel.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
BOOKS

HBR STORE
 
 
 
Compete in an AI world
 
The Artificial Intelligence (AI) revolution is well underway. Leading economists and business experts predict that AI will completely transform how we live and work. How will AI impact your industry, company, and career? Get up to speed on the latest research and intel with HBR’s 
Artificial Intelligence Library: How to Remain Competitive in an AI World
. With these resources, you’ll explore how to:
Lay the groundwork for transformation
Incorporate AI into your business strategy
Reimagine work processes
Manage people in this brave new world
Leverage AI to be a market leader
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
This specially priced 7-volume set includes:
 
 
Competing in the Age of AI: Strategy and Leadership When Algorithms and Networks Run the World
 
Packed with examples, many from the most powerful and innovative global AI-driven competitors and based on research in hundreds of firms across many sectors, this is your essential guide for rethinking how your firm competes and operates in the AI era.
 
 
 
 
 
Human + Machine: Reimagining Work in the Age of AI
 
In this much-needed management playbook, you’ll discover how to become an AI-fueled business so you can leap ahead on innovation and profitability.
 
 
 
 
 
Prediction Machines: The Simple Economics of Artificial Intelligence
 
Economists explain the profound impact of AI and how CEOs, managers, policy makers, investors and entrepreneurs can navigate the changes on the horizon.
 
 
 
 
 
HBR’s 10 Must Reads on AI, Analytics, and the New Machine Age
 
Contains the most important HBR articles to help you understand how these technologies work together, how to adopt them, and why your strategy can’t ignore them.
 
 
 
 
 
All-in On AI: How Smart Companies Win Big with Artificial Intelligence
 
Written by the author of 
Competing on Analytics
 and the head of Deloitte's US AI practice, 
All-In on AI
 will give you a rare inside look at what the leading adopters are doing, while providing you with the tools to put AI at the core of everything you do.
 
 
 
 
 
Power and Prediction: The Disruptive Economics of Artificial Intelligence
 
When prediction is taken to the max, industries transform, and with such transformation comes disruption. 
Power and Prediction
 explains what’s at the root of this and how we can make the coming AI disruption work for us, not against us.
 
 
 
 
 
Artificial Intelligence: Tools for Preparing Your Team for the Future
 
Includes a step-by-step training guide, comprehensive slide deck, case studies, and thought-provoking questions to help stimulate team thinking and kick off the discussions needed to move your company forward.
 
 
 
 
Whether you’re an entrepreneur, manager, or leader, learn what it takes to successfully compete in the AI world. This specially priced 7-item digital library is a must-have for managers who need to recognize the potential impact of AI, how it is driving future growth, and how they can compete.
 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
Discover more collections
Chart your path to management success with HBR’s curated collections.

subject: A Great Employee Experience Starts With L&D
body:
Check out the latest episode of the Training Industry podcast.  
View this email  in your browser
Today’s employees don’t just want opportunities to learn and grow — they expect them. And companies are looking to the training function to deliver an employee experience rooted in continuous learning.
Of course, creating a culture of learning is often easier said than done. For many training professionals, who are busy rolling out mandatory compliance programs or initiatives requested by business leaders, it sits on the (seemingly never-ending) list of “nice-to-haves.”
In this just-released episode of The Business of Learning, we turned to the pros for tips on integrating learning into the employee experience: We spoke with 
Sydney Savion
, senior director of learning services at Google and member of Training Industry Magazine’s editorial board, 
Thomas Fenstermacher, CPTM
, learning specialist at TrellisRX, and

subject: ***UNC Charlotte's 2023 Fall Recruiting Season***
body:
Good afternoon! 
UNC Charlotte’s 
Fall 2023 recruiting season is now open! 
Hurry to choose your preferred dates and register for recruiting events. 
Staff are available to discuss recruiting strategies to support your current and future needs. Please email us at 
recruit@charlotte.edu
 
and 
a member of our team will follow up
.  
Fall 2023 Recruiting Season: August 28 – November 30, 2023*
*Dates Not Available for recruiting events:
 Fall Career and Internship Fair September 15, Part-Time Job Fair October 4
 October 23, 24, and November 10, 22, 23, and 24. 
 
EMPLOYER/INDUSTRY-LED MEET UPS
Use your expertise to lead a small group of students in a professional development topic of your choice while branding your organization.
To schedule your Industry Meet Up please 
CLICK HERE
PROFESSIONALS IN RESIDENCE
This program puts you directly in the Career Commons of the University Career Center where you will be our drop-in expert for the day. This allows our office to provide industry advice directly to students while granting you the opportunity to brand your organization or to give back to Niner Nation as an alum!
To schedule your Professional In Residence please 
CLICK HERE
 
ON-CAMPUS INTERVIEWS
On-Campus Recruiting (OCR) is an effective way to create a strong presence on campus while recruiting talented UNC Charlotte students. The UCC can manage your schedule through a “Preselect” scheduling option or manage your own schedule through a “Room Reservation Only” scheduling option.
To reserve your preferred date(s), please do so through you
r 
Hire-A-Niner account
.  
RECRUITING TABLES
A recruiting table is a great way to build your brand at UNC Charlotte while you promote and recruit to fill opportunities at your organization. 
Please visit our 
Recruiting Table
 page for detailed information and available dates.
JOB POSTINGS
Attract applicants for your full time, experiential education, and part-time positions by posting in 
Hire-A-Niner
. 
To post your positions, please do so through your
 
Hire-A-Niner account
.
MICRO-INTERNSHIPS
Micro-Internships are short-term, paid, professional assignments that are similar to those given to new hires or interns. 
You can find more information on Micro-Internships here:  
https://info.parkerdewey.com/charlotte/featured
 
. 
FALL CAREER FAIRS
Attend Fall career fairs to connect directly with candidates and brand your organization on campus. All fairs are in-person events.
Fall Career + Internship Fair - Friday, September 15, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Focused 
on full-time jobs, internships, and co-ops; 2,000 candidates expected.
Part-Time Job Fair – Wednesday, October 4, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Focused on part-time, seasonal, temporary, and full-time non-degreed positions; 300 candidates  expected.
Visit 
careerfairs.charlotte.edu
 for additional information on events (including registration fees), registration links, and other campus career fairs. If you have any questions, please contact our events team at 
careerfairs@charlotte.edu
. 
INFORMATION SESSIONS
Showcase your organization’s culture and current opportunities while engaging with UNC Charlotte’s talented students 
Recommended for companies with well-established brands with UNC Charlotte students.
To reserve your Information Session, please do so through your
 
Hire-A-Niner account
. 
 
If you have questions, please email
 
recruit@charlotte.edu
.
Thank you for your contribution to the professional development of UNC Charlotte students and alumni! We look forward to partnering with you throughout the fall. 
Sincerely,
The University Career Center Employer Engagement Team
recruit@charlotte.edu

subject: Last chance to register for tomorrow's free live webinar!
body:
Expert insights on making work more meaningful and keeping people engaged and motivated.
 
 
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Whenever employees are surveyed about their jobs—whether by market researchers or by job sites like Monster and Glassdoor for their annual trend reports—there’s one factor that always features prominently: meaningful work.
  
Indeed, a 2021 report by global management consulting firm McKinsey & Company said that, over the past 30 years, “Americans have identified meaningful work as the most important aspect of a job—ahead of income, job security, and the number of hours worked.”
  
The same report also noted that, when employees find their work to be meaningful, their performance improves by 33%, they are 75% more committed to their organization, and are 49% less likely to leave.
  
What’s more, they found that a whopping 70% of people derive their sense of purpose solely from their work.
  
And yet, despite this, only 50% of employees find meaning in their work today.
  
To put it another way, one out of every two employees is just treading water, doing a job that they are neither particularly engaged in nor motivated by, and simply going through the motions until something better comes along.
  
This, of course, is a situation that no company, no matter how large or small, wants to find itself in.
  
But how can this all-too-common predicament be avoided?
  
What is it exactly that makes work meaningful for most people?
  
And how can companies even begin to understand what specifically makes work meaningful for each of the the dozens, or hundreds, or thousands of people in their organization?
  
For the answers to these questions, and the opportunity to ask your own, join our live webinar with 
Katie Bailey
, Professor of Work and Employment at King’s Business School, King’s College London and co-editor of ‘The Oxford Handbook of Meaningful Work’, and 
Blake Allan
, Associate Professor and Program Director of Counseling Psychology at the University of Houston, which takes place 
TOMORROW (Thursday June 29) at 10am Central Time
. Registration is free, and (if you’re quick!) you can 
sign up here.
  
I hope to see you there!
 
Casey
Casey Wahl
Founder & CEO
P.S. Want to know more about how Attuned can help you improve communication and increase motivation? 
Take a tour!
 
P.P.S. Want even more in-depth insights? Download our free White Papers on 
Extrinsic Motivation vs Intrinsic Motivation
, 
Psychological Safety in the Hybrid Work Era
, and 
The Power of the Nudge
, as well as our newly released 
The State of Motivation Report 2023
.
 
If this was forwarded to you, subscribe here!

subject: How Are You Supporting Your LGBTQ+ Employees Beyond Pride? 🌈
body:
What steps are you taking to support the LGBTQ+ community and ensure that every individual is respected and protected, year-round?
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Intent vs. impact is one of my favorite concepts when it comes to our DEI journeys. It’s so difficult to get right, and requires ongoing investigation, calibration and adjustment. 
 
For organizations, applying intent vs. impact means digging in to better understand if our strategies and efforts are hitting the mark - not in our estimation, but in the estimation of others. What might have worked well in the past may no longer work, or be enough, given the shifting landscape. If (when, inevitably) we discover gaps, we then create psychologically safe interactions and forums to follow up and determine what needs to change. We at JBC do this with every workplace community struggling to belong and thrive. 
 
So what does true support - dictated 
by
 the community - look like? How have you incorporated this into your strategy? And how are you doing, throughout the year? 
If we’ve learned one thing from the last few years, it’s that specific “celebration” days and months are not enough, but that sustained support and advocacy need to happen, 365 days a year. 
 
To explore this, we at Jennifer Brown Consulting are launching 
LGBTQ+ listening sessions
. Created to identify the specific sentiments and challenges facing LGBTQ+ employees, the Listening Sessions will support organizations who want to ensure that their policies, practices, and procedures support the changing needs of the LGBTQ+ community beyond Pride.
 
The listening sessions will include:
Safe conversations with a senior consultant to understand the current state
An executive report of key findings from the listening sessions with recommendations
A debrief session with a senior consultant to align on incorporating recommendations into your DEI strategy 
One month a year is not enough. A continuous commitment to LGBTQ+ employees is an essential part of a DEI strategy where we create equitable cultures where everyone thrives. To learn how you can create lasting change with our listening sessions, inquire below and mention the LGBTQ+ listening sessions.
Inquire Here
 
Don't Miss My LinkedIn Live with Dr. Elijah Nicholas Tomorrow at 12:30PM ET!
 
Last week, Elon Musk tweeted that the words 'cis' or 'cisgender' are now considered slurs on twitter. Please join me in conversation with Award-Winning Transgender Advocate Dr. Elijah Nicholas, as we discuss what this means for the transgender community, the importance of understanding and using gender inclusive language, and why LGBTQ+ allies are needed now more than ever. subject: Take PRIDE in your workplace policies
body:
Does your workplace practice a culture of LGBTQ+ inclusivity? 
 
 
Does your workplace practice a culture of LGBTQ+ inclusivity? 
Nearly 
6%
 of the average workforce is 
LGBTQ+
.* Your DE&I efforts 
need
 to include individuals who are 
lesbian
, 
gay
, 
bisexual
, 
transgender
, 
queer
 
+ other sexual or gender identities
 in order to maintain business success. 
Just increasing your 
workforce diversity
 or writing 
internal policy
 isn’t enough. Your organization needs to be 
truly welcoming
 for employees to come as their 
most authentic selves
. How can you help create a sense of 
belonging
?
 
 
  
 
Update current policies
 
Anti-harassment
, 
bullying
 and 
nondiscrimination policies
 are top of mind, but consider your 
dress code
 and 
restroom policies
. Are you practicing neutrality for employees’ 
gender identity
? 
  
  
 
Provide training
 
As 
LGBTQ+ terminology
 and 
culture
 continue to evolve, your organization’s training must adapt along with it or 
risk becoming outdated
. 
Gender-neutral language
, ways to 
report harassment or bullying
, and 
addressing implicit bias
 are 
essential
 to fostering an 
inclusive culture
. 
  
  
 
Set Expectations 
An inclusive workplace is one where 
all employees can contribute and feel they belong
. Regardless of personal beliefs, 
ALL
 employees should be treated with 
respect
. Leadership must model 
inclusive behaviors
 and adopt a 
zero-tolerance approach to workplace incivility
. 
  
 
Establishing a culture of 
appreciation
 for employees’ differences at every level is 
crucial
 to both your 
bottom line
 and 
employee well-being
. 
We’ve designed 
SHRM INCLUSION 2023
 to maximize your learnings around 
unconscious bias
, 
DE&I strategy
 and 
employee well-being
. Join us in 
Savannah Oct. 30-Nov. 1
 to foster a 
truly inclusive
 LGBTQ+ work environment. 
Register Now
 
  
Secure the best rate when you register by 
July 14
. Don’t delay booking as registration and housing 
will sell out
! 
  
  
* Source: 
Public and Private Sector Employees’ Perceptions of Discrimination Against LGBTQ People
. UCLA, 2021.
 
  
 
 
Connect with us on social!
 
  
  
  
  
 
1800 Duke Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314 USA

we can talk about how we can make the modules work for you.
Because inclusion isn’t cookie-cutter
So the real kicker with our courses is that so much 
of the modules can be 
customised
. From the questions 
we ask your people, to the resources that get uploaded.
If you have a policy you want everyone to read then we can add that in there.
Got a specific question you want your managers to answer? 
Let’s get that in there too!
Our modules have:
🕹 professionally recorded videos
🕹 signposting to other resources and readings such as web links, books, podcasts, films etc depending on the subject
🕹 reflection activities
🕹 internal group discussion activities
🕹 quizzes
🕹 downloadable pdf resources for employees and managers
And it’s better to start with these two modules; 
to develop some foundational understanding at your organisation, 
than to go straight into talking about more sensitive subjects such as racism, ageism, homophobia and more… that your people might not be prepped for.
! WE HAVE AN OFFER FOR YOU !
If you purchase one or both of these courses before 4pm on 30th June there is a 
5% early-bird discount available!
So let’s get EDI rolling at your company and hopefully you’ll do a much better job of avoiding some 
very tricky situations
.
To find out more about the courses and to watch a short taster video,
visit the launch page
.
But if you’d rather fast-track talking to me about the courses then 
book a call right away
.
Thanks so much,
Heeral

Introducing our monthly wrap newsletter!

sustainability steps
 with APCO
 
 
Bonus Biz Buzz:
Is

What's new at Good Things?
 
Decoration Methods Explained, v
iew 
here
We listen to our customers.  After receiving similar questions about particular print methods, we created a list of the most common decoration methods. Learn how they're used, what they're used on and other important info.
Learn about Decoration Methods 
 
Trending Products — June 2023
You know it's Winter in Australia when the most popular products ordered are Umbrellas and Socks!
View June's #1 Umbrella 
View June's #1 Sock 
 
Download the Winter 2023 Project Vision Look Book
Products that will inspire your next winter campaign.
Download Winter Look Book 
 
 
Next Steps to Sustainability
We recently received our 
APCO Performance Summary
 for 2023 — things are looking good. We have been categorised as Level 4 'Leading', in sustainability. Our goal is to reach Level 5 'Beyond Best Practice' in 2024.
Bonus Biz Buzz
 
(Photo credit: Nikki Short/NCA NewsWire)
Is Australia's inflation causing more shoplifting?
 
Short answer — yes. 
 
An article
 published on 19 June stated that Canberrans are the worst supermarket shoplifters in the country! Supermarket giant, Woolsworth, had a total of 5.27 million items (worth $16.27 million) stolen from their Canberra shelves in 2022.
 
Financial Review
 says Australian spending will slowdown over the next several months. "A survey of 1000 consumers in the fortnight ending June 1, found a real shift in mindset as cost-of-living pressures climb."
 
(Photo credit: Daniel Miles/ABC News)
'Fantales' have been discontinued — marketing strategy or legit?
 
Nestlé announced last week that they will discontinue the Aussie favourite. Many will flock to shelves to buy the last stock. So the question is, are they gone for good? Read more 
here
.

subject: Redefine Your Workplace Through DE&I
body:
Build a more inclusive and dedicated workplace.
 
 
In your organization, is diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) an afterthought? 
A strong DEI initiative
 
increases 
employee engagement
 
and 
innovation and plays a pivotal role in attracting and retaining top talent. High levels of belonging translate to: 
56%
 
higher
 job performance.
50% lower 
turnover risk.

sick days used.

resources, strategies and policies
 to help you lead organizational change through DE&I today.

from the Workplace

subject: MCF DEI consultant proposal
body:
Dear Hannah, 
 
Thank you so much for your proposal to the Minnesota Council on Foundations as we seek a consultant to assist with our DEI work. We had 17 excellent proposals. We have found that a small number of them bring a combination of unique aspects to this work, such as deep understanding of membership organizations, familiarity with the sector of philanthropy serving organizations, and significant organizational development experience. We have decided to move ahead with those proposals for the interview phase. I’m sorry your proposal is not among them. 
 
I appreciate knowing about your work through your proposal. I will be sure to keep you in mind if we have other related work in the future. 
 
Many thanks for your proposal. 
 
Susie Brown
 
Susie Brown [she/her]
President
Minnesota Council on Foundations
612-335-3557 (o) 651-295-6952 (c) 
sbrown@mcf.org

subject: The Forum Quarterly, June 2023
body:
Welcome to The Forum’s June newsletter, the second of our Combining Forces
(x)
 year! 
Hello Forum family, 
My name is Joanne K. Reeck and I’ll be serving as the Interim Executive Director of The Forum on Workplace Inclusion. I’d like to take this opportunity to briefly introduce myself. I have worked in higher education for 20 years and have over 20 years of facilitation experience. 
Here's my official bio.
Offline, I can often be found camping and hiking at state parks with my 11-year-old son, Mateo, and rescue dog, Nova. We also spend time with extended family in Northern Minnesota.
With the solstice and warm weather, it's officially summer in Minnesota. As this new season emerges, The Forum follows suit. We are now busy analyzing the recent 35th annual conference and gearing up for the next round of Forum learning and community building.
There is a lot packed into this newsletter, but first I want to acknowledge two sponsors: Piper Sandler is our newsletter sponsor. Their support makes this publication possible. Our other 365 sponsor is Colgate-Palmolive, underwriting accessibility for all the events throughout the year outside of the annual conference. 
And now a bit about this quarter’s newsletter features:
Our feature writer, Jacey Mismash, profiles a local Minnesota artist – Nyttu Chongo – who performed on the Orchestra Hall stage during the opening celebration at the annual conference.
Catherine Hurley, from the Forum staff, shares highlights from the Combining Forces
(x) 
conference.
Our video short features Yaro Fong-Olivares and Rebecca McDougal of Bentley University’s Center for Women and Business. They will talk about intersectional gender equity in the workplace.
I hope you enjoy this edition of The Forum newsletter!
Thanks for your involvement with The Forum.
 
At Piper Sandler, we believe 
diverse, equitable and inclusive teams with unique backgrounds, skills, and experiences
 create an ideal environment in which our employees can thrive, personally and professionally, while contributing their 
unique and valuable perspectives
 to the firm.
We strive to 
enable bright, committed people to work in partnership within an inclusive environment that allows each person to achieve personal success and add value
 to our teams and communities. By living up to the values of our organization we support our employees, and benefit our clients, shareholders and our communities.
Interested in joining the team? Visit 
https://www.pipersandler.com/careers
.
 
Forum Profiles
 opens a window in to the life of DEI change makers and leaders.
Combining Forces
(x) 
is a theme we are celebrating throughout 2023. Photo collage, quote salad and graphic art curation by Catherine Hurley, Director of Partnership and Engagement at The Forum on Workplace Inclusion.
The Forum's cathartic and celebratory 35th Annual Conference was a visual feast — much more fun as a show and tell. Please enjoy the photos, be inspired by the quotes, watch the three general sessions and apply the graphic concepts to your daily human interactions. If you attended the conference, remember you can revisit all of the presentations on-demand through the end of August.
 
Read on...
 
"When folks ask me about 
the best gathering of #DEI practitioners and advocates
, I always tell them it's The Forum on Workplace Inclusion in Minneapolis."
"
The vibe and aesthetics were amazing
. Beautiful opener!"
"I love this conference. It is the 
highlight
 of my year."
"I attended to see if the hype was real and I planned use time at the conference to create content...but I just 
couldn't break away from the conversations, community, the learning, the CONNECTIONS
."
"I feel a 
renewed energy of motivation
 and purpose."
"After spending a couple of days at The Forum on Workplace Inclusion, it was great to see 
so many professionals who continue working every day to make workplaces and communities better for all
."
"I am honored. 
Grateful. Reeling. Empowered. Full. Joyous. Affirmed
."
 
Graphic Summary from The Forum's 35th Annual Conference (thanks to Inclusion ACTION and Blue Beyond Consulting)
Upcoming Forum Events
Forum Webinar: July 20, 2023 11:00 am - 12:00 pm CT - Bridging Divides In Nonprofits: How Not To Take Passionate Employees for Granted
Forum Webinar: August 17, 2023 11:00 am - 12:00 pm CT - Rising Talent: How To Build And Sustain Early Career Programs To Build Diverse Talent Pipelines
Professional Development Lab: September 7, 2023 11:00 am - 2:00 pm CT - Collectively Healing: Breaking The Cycle Of White Supremacy
Forum Webinar: September 21, 2023 11:00 am - 12:00 pm CT - Six Pillars: A Guide To Strategic DEI Work In The University Setting
 
Register Today
 
And here's an upcoming conference from Diversity MBA, one of The Forum's allies:
 
 
Here at The Forum, we believe 
the arts
 are an essential connector for DEI.
Art & Music is guest written by student and emerging writers from our home organization, Augsburg University. Thanks to Augsburg graduate, 
Jacey Mismash
, for this quarter's profile.
Messages From Beyond — The Power of Music With Nyttu Chongo
 
Community gatherings are often filled with the buzz of chatter, the energy of laughter, and a strong sense of togetherness. Growing up in the Gaza province of Mozambique, Nyttu Chongo remembered another important staple of these collectives – 
The music. 
“As a kid, you show up, and they encourage you to start singing, dancing, and then playing” Chongo reminisces, “that is the way my music started.”
After growing up surrounded by the music of nature, of community, and his ancestors, it wouldn’t be until 2011 when Chongo realized...
Read on...
 
 
Forum Digital Short
: 
Empowering Intersectional Gender Equity
Watch Here
 
Have a great summer!
Promote your organization in this newsletter or underwrite Forum 365 Webinars, Podcasts or Professional Development Labs. 
For more info, contact:
 
Catherine Hurley

,

,

 at any time.

subject: AI and DEI Comms Workshop Thursday
body:
Follow up from May webinar on AI and DEI Communications ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hi. Have you played around in AI since we met up in May? I hope so and I hope you're ready to get some real work done using AI.  
This Thursday June 29th is the hands-on workshop we talked about. 
The workshop is limited. We intentionally want a small group so we can work with each of you and everyone can learn from each other. 
The signup link for this Thursday's workshop changed:
REGISTER
Here's what we'll do together on Thursday...and we'll be joined by Parchelle Tashi who will walk us through the prompt exercises. 
We'll spend this 2-hour workshop:
Learning more about AI's capabilities for communicators
Put what we learn to practice in ChatGPT
Try prompts to help you on a project you're working on
Avoid bias and embed DEI communications practices into your work
Generative AI can increase speed, creativity and efficiency. And, we need to learn how it can introduce bias and cause more harm than good in our communications. We'll look at how to reap the benefits while balancing out human empathy, authenticity, accuracy and inclusivity. 
Workshop deliverables: 
Strong draft of current project using AI
DEI LENS on Generative AI results
Practice and increased knowledge about prompting (quality of questions you ask)
Link to recording
Handouts/slides 
EXCLUSIVE BONUS: By signing up for the workshop, we'll send you the slides and recording from the May webinar. 
Meet my co-facilitator Parchelle
With a deep passion for AI and DEI, Parchelle is dedicated to exploring the intersection of these fields and promoting inclusive practices. As a teacher, she strives to foster meaningful discussions and critical thinking by utilizing thought-provoking prompts and asking high-quality questions that encourage introspection and foster a diverse range of perspectives.
----
Below are the links we talked about in May. I'll have more to share on Thursday. Things are changing rapidly in this space as you know. I'll show you more tools that will blow your hair back. 
ChatGPT
AgentGPT
PDFGPT
Midjourney
This Person Does Not Exist
Stable Diffusion
Supercreator
AdCreative
TryItOn
Soundful
Runway
AIToolsDirectory
See you soon!
kim
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register for the AI and DEI Comms Workshop

PO Box 2466 • Santa Cruz, CA • 95063

subject: Ignite the spark in workplace culture
body:
Do you have a robust DE&I strategy?
 
 
Ignite the spark
in workplace culture
 
Diverse organizations outperform less-diverse competitors in 
revenue
, 
profits
, and 
employee satisfaction
.* How does your workplace stack up against your competition? 
Here are 
three reasons
 why attending 
SHRM INCLUSION 2023
 should be your 
top priority
: 
 
  
 
Expand your knowledge
 
With 
50+ sessions
 and 
75+ speakers
 over the course of 
three days
, you’ll return to your organization with all the information you need to turn your 
diversity
, 
equity
, and 
inclusion
 (DE&I) ideas into 
company priorities
. 
  
  
 
Network
 
We designed the agenda to 
maximize
 opportunities for 
meaningful connections
 with peers and experts alike. Whether you’re new to inclusion training or you’ve been around the block, you’ll be able to foster a true DE&I community. 
  
  
 
Flexible Learning 
Gain insights from 
deep-diving panel discussions
, 
expert-led general sessions
 and 
spotlight stages
 with emerging ideas that cater to 
your
 needs and learning style. Can’t make it to Savannah? Join us 
online
 and learn on your own time with access to sessions for 
30 days
 after the conference. 
  
 
When you attend 
INCLUSION 2023
, you’re taking an 
important
 step towards enacting 
real change
 in your world of work. An inclusive culture is 
great
 for the bottomline, and 
vital
 for employees. 
Register Now
 
  
Secure the best rate when you register by 
July 14
. Don’t delay booking as registration and housing 
will sell out
! 
  
  
* Source: 
Ensuring Workplace Inclusion for LGBTQ+ Employees
, SHRM, 2022.

subject: Workshop This Thursday: AI and Its Impact on DEI Communications
body:
Bring a project you're working on and let's practice prompts ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Drafting content 
in AI
 
with the 
human element
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Generative AI is moving fast. Can it help us be more inclusive? 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register Now 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
AI and The Impact on DEI Communications Workshop hosted by Kim Clark & Parchelle Tashi
We'll spend this 2-hour workshop:
Learning more about AI's capabilities for communicators
Put what we learn to practice in ChatGPT
Try prompts to help you on a project you're working on
Avoid bias and embed DEI communications practices into your work
Generative AI can increase speed, creativity and efficiency. And, we need to learn how it can introduce bias and cause more harm than good in our communications. We'll look at how to reap the benefits while balancing out human empathy, authenticity, accuracy and inclusivity. 
Workshop deliverables: 
Strong draft of current project using AI
DEI LENS on Generative AI results
Practice and increased knowledge about prompting (quality of questions you ask)
Link to recording
Handouts/slides
About Kim
Kim Clark works with folks who are serious about learning and applying The Communicator’s DEI LENS to build strong relationships and results in teams and organizations. She is the co-author of Amazon bestseller, 
The Conscious Communicator.
 
About Parchelle
With a deep passion for AI and DEI, Parchelle is dedicated to exploring the the intersection of these fields and promoting inclusive practices. As a teacher, she strives to foster meaningful discussions and critical thinking by utilizing thought-provoking prompts and asking high-quality questions that encourage introspection and foster a diverse range of perspectives.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Register Now
