subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 June 25, 2023
body:
New vendor directory, research report sale and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Here at Training Industry, we understand the importance of making informed decisions when it comes to learning and development (L&D). That’s why we've provided the tools and resources you need to have the biggest impact on your organization.
We’ve revamped our 
vendor directory
 to make it easier for you to find the right training partner, and we’re offering discounts on our research reports and e-books to help you make data-driven decisions. If you are looking to enhance your professional skills, check out our 
course catalog
 and take advantage of the last week of our summer sale.
We’re also featuring articles about how training can improve the 
employee experience
. We hope this week’s insights and resources will help you reach your goals as a learning leader.
As always, we love hearing from you! Email 
editor@trainingindustry.com

Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor

With thousands of training vendors across the L&D landscape, choosing the right partner can be a daunting task. Save time by starting your search with the

subject: Organizing for trans kids in small town Kentucky
body:
🤠SURJ strategy, part four
This is the fourth installment in a series of emails about SURJ’s three year strategy to block authoritarianism from spreading and build the white flank of the multiracial majority. You can view the whole series 
on our website
.
 
Dear Hannah,
 
The news about queer people these days is mostly horrifying and heartbreaking, so we’re proud to share a bit of queer joy and resilience as we come to the end of pride month. 
 
This past week, members of the Kentucky People’s Union, a project of SURJ located in a small town in Eastern Kentucky, in partnership with Ashland Pride 
organized over 60 trans students, their parents, educators, and allies (pictured above) to demand that the local school board vote to not comply with SB 150
, one of the worst anti-trans bills in the country, which includes a ban on gender-affirming care for trans youth and requires school districts to create policies that ban children from using bathrooms that align with their genders.
 
 
The Kentucky People’s Union is bringing together trans youth, working people, and community members who are ready to fight for all Kentuckians’ rights and dignity. 
Will you give a gift today to help KPU grow its work?
 
Then, will you give a gift to support Ashland Pride, a key partner in KPU’s organizing?
As you probably know, SURJ has deep roots in Kentucky. Some of our founders are from Kentucky and we have been investing in this majority-white, rural state for years.
 It’s a place where Mitch McConnell and the GOP have built an empire, but it’s also a place full of working white people ready to come with us. 
We’ve seen this time and again in our campaigns– whether 
defeating a statewide amendment to ban abortion
 or 
electing a slate of progressive judges in Louisville
 who support ending cash bail. 
Kentucky People’s Union is a key part of SURJ’s strategy to build grassroots power in small towns and rural places in the South to block far right radicalization and undermine their base of support– and a cornerstone of our work in Kentucky. 
Learn more about KPU
 
A year ago, KPU had its first meeting of about 12 people  (pictured above). Since then, they have knocked on hundreds of doors in the community, helped lead the SURJ campaign that stopped the abortion ban, and rallied at the state capitol to help defend trans people’s rights. A year after that first meeting, KPU’s member meeting had over 50 people in attendance where they voted to launch a housing rights campaign (pictured below).
 
 
Right now, KPU is building out this housing campaign, organizing the local school board to not comply with SB 150, and working alongside SURJ’s national work to re-elect Democratic Governor Andy Beshear. As our work in Kentucky grows, we’re hatching plans to expand SURJ’s organizing across Appalachia. 
KPU is an example of what we know at SURJ: that there are millions of working white people waiting for us to talk to them and waiting to be invited in. 
Will you give a gift today to grow this work in Appalachia and beyond?
In solidarity,  
SURJ and the Kentucky People’s Union
I'd like to give!
 
 
Showing Up for Racial Justice

body:
Have you mastered them all?
View this email in your browser
.
 
Training Industry research has identified 
seven core competencies
 critical to training manager success, with the most important being the ability to 
strategically align
 training to business goals. What's more? Our research shows that 
mastery of these competencies is associated with salaries up to $20,000 higher for training professionals.
Utilizing a blended learning approach including self-paced eLearning, live facilitation and group application activities, the

subject: Accepted: Tentative: LCW & Hope Chicago
Attend SIETAR USA's July 2023 Webinar!
body:
"Belonging: A Journey for Each of Us" w/ Megan Norton ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WEBINAR: 
"Belonging: A Journey for Each of Us
"
Your Presenter:
Megan Norton, 
Author, TCK Consultant, & Intercultural Trainer
 
 
 
 
July 12, 2023 @ 11:30 AM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
Having a sense of belonging—or multiple belongings –is a journey for every individual to reflect on and celebrate. Increasingly we participate in conversations about “belonging” in multiple sectors and with several lenses. What does it mean to have a ‘sense of belonging’ when your entire life has been shaped by global mobility and different cultures? Third Culture Kids (TCKs) deal with issues of belonging because they have spent a significant part of their upbringing crossing cultures. Their experiences can make it challenging to find, form, and sustain a sense of belonging. In this webinar, Megan leads the discussion about what it means to belong in multiple communities: personal, professional, familial, cultural, and spiritual. Megan invites participants to ponder how to belong, where to belong, and why to belong. 
 
Registration = FREE for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
 
Registration = $25.00 for nonmembers
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Megan Norton
Megan Norton is an author, Third Culture Kid (TCK) consultant, intercultural trainer, podcast host of 
A Culture Story
, and writer at 
adultthirdculturekid.com
. Growing up as a U.S. diplomat dependent, she lived in 6 countries (US., South Africa, South Korea, Germany, Japan, Israel), also as an adult in 4 more countries (Austria, Greece, Hungary, Poland) in addition to 5 U.S. States. She leads both in-person and virtual TCK Transitions Seminars, university retreats and Intercultural Dialogue groups for a variety of international entities. An active member of Families in Global Transition, she served on the Board of Directors from 2018 – 2022 and has been the co-chair of the NAFSA Global Nomad/TCK Member Interest Group for the past 6 years. Her book, 
Belonging Beyond Borders: How Adult Third Culture Kids Can Cultivate a Sense of Belonging
, equips and empowers globally mobile youth to recognize their cultural competencies and apply them in various contexts. 
 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Megan Norton
Megan Norton is an author, Third Culture Kid (TCK) consultant, intercultural trainer, podcast host of 
A Culture Story
, and writer at 
adultthirdculturekid.com
. Growing up as a U.S. diplomat dependent, she lived in 6 countries (US., South Africa, South Korea, Germany, Japan, Israel), also as an adult in 4 more countries (Austria, Greece, Hungary, Poland) in addition to 5 U.S. States. She leads both in-person and virtual TCK Transitions Seminars, university retreats and Intercultural Dialogue groups for a variety of international entities. An active member of Families in Global Transition, she served on the Board of Directors from 2018 – 2022 and has been the co-chair of the NAFSA Global Nomad/TCK Member Interest Group for the past 6 years. Her book, 
Belonging Beyond Borders: How Adult Third Culture Kids Can Cultivate a Sense of Belonging
, equips and empowers globally mobile youth to recognize their cultural competencies and apply them in various contexts.

subject: Ignite the spark in workplace culture
body:
Do you have a robust DE&I strategy?
 
 
Ignite the spark
in workplace culture
 
Diverse organizations outperform less-diverse competitors in 
revenue
, 
profits
, and 
employee satisfaction
.* How does your workplace stack up against your competition? 
Here are 
three reasons
 why attending 
SHRM INCLUSION 2023
 should be your 
top priority
: 
 
  
 
Expand your knowledge
 
With 
50+ sessions
 and 
75+ speakers
 over the course of 
three days
, you’ll return to your organization with all the information you need to turn your 
diversity
, 
equity
, and 
inclusion
 (DE&I) ideas into 
company priorities
. 
  
  
 
Network
 
We designed the agenda to 
maximize
 opportunities for 
meaningful connections
 with peers and experts alike. Whether you’re new to inclusion training or you’ve been around the block, you’ll be able to foster a true DE&I community. 
  
  
 
Flexible Learning 
Gain insights from 
deep-diving panel discussions
, 
expert-led general sessions
 and 
spotlight stages
 with emerging ideas that cater to 
your
 needs and learning style. Can’t make it to Savannah? Join us 
online
 and learn on your own time with access to sessions for 
30 days
 after the conference. 
  
 
When you attend 
INCLUSION 2023
, you’re taking an 
important
 step towards enacting 
real change
 in your world of work. An inclusive culture is 
great
 for the bottomline, and 
vital
 for employees. 
Register Now
 
  
Secure the best rate when you register by 
July 14
. Don’t delay booking as registration and housing 
will sell out
! 
  
  
* Source: 
Ensuring Workplace Inclusion for LGBTQ+ Employees
, SHRM, 2022.

subject: Sailing on the Seven Seas of SaaS
body:
Cutting-edge insights from SaaStr Europa.
 
 
Hi Hannah,
 
The past few years have been a rip-roaring odyssey for Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies.
  
During the pandemic, many rode the crest of a wave of hugely inflated valuations as their stock prices soared to record highs. Then, in 2022, came a sobering splash of cold water as global financial headwinds conspired to sink those deceptively bouyant valuations by an average of 50%—and in some cases, much more—while VC capital hoisted anchor and charted a course for sunnier climes.
  
Now, as we head into the second half of 2023, while the waters may still be choppy for those sailing on the good ship SaaS, it seems that the worst of the storms are over, and a brave new world is starting to glimmer on the horizon.
  
It was fitting, then, that this year’s SaaStr Europa event should be held at the historic Tobacco Dock in London, with the world’s largest community of SaaS executives, founders, and entrepreneurs coming together for two days of workshops, panel discussions, Q&As, and more just a stone’s throw from the flowing waters of the Thames.
  
Following on from our voyage to the inaugural SaaStr APAC in Singapore in February, Attuned was once again part of the armada of SaaS companies that descended on London, alongside heavyweight guests from the likes of Loom, UiPath and Cockroach Labs, as well as SaaStr’s swashbuckling captain, Jason Lemkin.
  
Read our report—including why “Your first 50 hires should be pirates and romantics”—here.
 
Free Webinar!
How can organizations make work more meaningful? That’s the question we’ll be exploring in our next free live webinar, which takes place on 
Thursday June 29 at 10am Central Time
. Science journalist Tania Rabesandratana will be joined by Katie Bailey, Professor of Work and Employment at King’s Business School, King’s College London, and Blake Allan, Associate Professor and Program Director of Counseling Psychology at the University of Houston, to craft a contemporary definition of meaningful work, and offer advice on how organizations can foster it to boost engagement, motivation and performance. 
Sign up in seconds here.
 
Have a motivating day!
 
Casey
Casey Wahl
Founder & CEO
P.S. Attuned transforms communication and turbo-charges motivation. Want to know how it can benefit your business?
 
Let's talk.
 
P.P.S. Want even more in-depth insights? Download our free White Papers on 
Extrinsic Motivation vs Intrinsic Motivation
, 
Psychological Safety in the Hybrid Work Era
, and 
The Power of the Nudge
, as well as our newly released 
The State of Motivation Report 2023
.
 
If this was forwarded to you, subscribe here!
 
 
 
 
 
 
Attuned.ai
2-28-8 Jingumae 4F
Shibuya-ku, Tokyo
150-0001 JAPAN
team@attuned.ai

subject: Sales Comp’23 Early-Bird Rates End Soon—Don’t Miss Out!
body:
Secure the lowest rates today!
 
Don’t Let Our Early Bird Rates Fly Away. 
Register Now and Save! 
 
Time flies — and so will our lowest registration rates if you don’t act soon to secure your spot at Sales Comp’23! Early bird rates expire June 30th. Register today to lock in our best rates to this once-a-year, career-changing event — the ONLY conference that digs deep into the dynamic world of sales compensation. Join us August 21-23 in Chicago for a program packed with learning, networking, and new resources to help your organization excel. 
 
 
 
Get My Early-Bird Registration 
Get Real-World Tips from Trusted Experts
 
Sales Comp’23 offers 20+ interactive sessions across three cutting-edge tracks — Sales Compensation, Sales Analytics and Sales Operations — so you can customize your experience to align with your own goals and interests. You won’t get an experience like this anywhere else, with invaluable sessions such as…
 
Think Like a Gamer: How to Protect Your Sales Comp Plan from Incentive Gaming
 
We’ve all encountered salespeople who find loopholes in the sales comp plan to boost their own pay while undermining their employer’s goals. In this practical session, learn to think like these “gamers” so you can anticipate their next moves — and beat them at their own game. The presenters will provide an overview of gaming tactics derived from interviews with 40 leaders in sales and sales ops. You’ll get tips for spotting and fixing holes in your own plan. Game over!
 
Speakers:
 
 
 
Colin Wong
Blue Horizons Group
 
 
 
 
Tim Garder
Utah State University
 
 
Don’t miss this chance to stay on top of the latest tactics to attract, motivate and sustain high-octane sales teams that outperform their markets. 
Please, don’t delay – early bird rates expire June 30!
 
 
Claim My Spot

subject: Our first 2 Digital Modules are live!
body:
Digital modules that kickstart EDI
 
View this email in your browser
It's official - 
our first two digital modules are live and 
available for you to bring in-house.
Working with Inclusion and Respect
&
Microaggressions
This is a huge deal for a couple of reasons...
💵 It means two of our most often-requested workshops are now available to organisations who might not otherwise have been able to invest in live workshops: either because they were out of budget for small firms, or because they had too many people for live workshops to be economical in large firms.
🎙 We're making EDI accessible to people in a way that isn't preachy or judgemental.
📢 "Not for you, for everyone" (Telfar Clemens) - we're helping people work together to build inclusive environments for 
everyone
 through building accountability, respect and compassion in our interactions at work, and by minimising the impact of our biases
What do you get?
🕹 professionally recorded videos
🕹 signposting to other resources and readings such as web links, books, podcasts, films etc depending on the subject
🕹 reflection activities
🕹 internal group discussion activities
🕹 quizzes
🕹 downloadable pdf resources for employees and managers
* AND WE HAVE AN OFFER FOR YOU *
There is an early-bird offer available until 5pm on Friday 30th June. 
To get a 5% reduction on your investment get in touch soon. 
(From 1st July standard pricing will apply.)
So let’s get EDI rolling at your company and hopefully you’ll do a much better job of avoiding some 
very tricky situations
.
To find out more about the courses and to watch a short taster video,
visit the launch page
.
But if you’d rather fast-track talking to me about the courses then 
book a call right away
.
Thanks so much,
Heeral

subject: From Day One: Where Recruiters Roam When Hiring Slows
body:
They were HR heroes during the Great Resignation, when employers were desperate to fill millions of jobs. Recruiters helped make possible the hiring surge of 2022, when U.S. employers
 hired a record 76 million people
. But then the tide turned. Now it’s the recruiters who are getting pink slips, some of them before the workers they brought on. “The demand for recruiters has dropped at three times the rate of overall hiring demand,” according to data from 
LinkedIn
.
 
We've secured an exclusive opportunity for our members to take part 
in AARP's Employee Caregiver Program Series!
This series, free of charge for From Day One subscribers, is an easy way to make your workplace more caregiver-inclusive via live virtual programs on a range of challenges that working family caregivers face at home and work.
To learn more and reserve a spot, visit 
caregiving.fromdayone.co
 
What happens to these professionals when the market for their job description crashes? Many leaders are finding creative ways to keep recruiters on staff even with little or no hiring to do. In the process, they’re reinforcing the business value of talent acquisition and recognizing the mix of people skills that comes with the role of selling a company as a great place to work. “We saw it as an opportunity to repurpose our skills,” Selin Molinari, director of talent acquisition at the business-and-tech consulting firm Slalom, told From Day One contributing editor Emily McCrary-Ruiz-Esparza.
 
Recruiters on Tour to Learn New Skills
 
Last October, Slalom created a “tour” program, sending recruiters on temporary assignments to teams like sales or marketing. A recruiter might be “on tour” full-time for three months or six months, or they might be working on marketing projects for 20 hours per week and building the talent pipeline for the other 20. Of Slalom’s 400 recruiters, a quarter are currently on tour. 
 
Touring recruiters get a chance at career development—especially appealing for early career workers. For recruiters who crave experience and exposure, tours are a powerful means of retention. Given the pace of skill obsolescence, 
workers are willing to change jobs for career development opportunities
, and employers need low-cost ways to upskill. Internal mobility is beneficial at a time when it’s become hard to attract and retain all kinds of workers, but 
especially in HR, where burnout is high
.
 
As hiring has slowed, internal mobility is increasing, according to LinkedIn’s 
May 2023 Global Talent Trends Report
. “Celebrating lateral movement also addresses one of the risks associated with mobility—hitting a glass ceiling,” writes Kevin Oakes in 
Harvard Business Review
. 
 
Slalom’s program also prevents HR leaders from having to shut down recruiting operations, avoiding a cumbersome reboot when hiring resumes. Some recruiters on tour still devote time to filling the pipeline with leads, and Slalom created a team to manage the tours, so when hiring picks up again, the TA team knows where to find its recruiters.
 
Temporarily reassigning recruiters lifts them out of the usual cycle of hiring surges and layoffs, giving talent acquisition the chance to demonstrate its versatility. Recruiters not only have soft skills like communication and relationship-building—talent-sourcers today are also data analysts, 
employer brand marketers
, and strategic, long-term thinkers. As HR’s influence permeates every corner of a business, its members are becoming highly developed all-rounders. 
 
Robyn Thornton, director of talent acquisition at recruiting tech company SeekOut, considers relocating recruiters to other teams an investment in their long-term success and a natural fit for a department whose skills have become so extensive. This strategy can also bolster long-term job security for the team. “If you’re not hiring, they think that, ‘Oh, that’s an easy place to have some cuts,’” said Thornton. Deploying them business-wide dispels that myth.
 
While hiring is slow at SeekOut, Katelyn Harris Lange, a senior talent sourcer, has been working on content marketing, sales, and LinkedIn strategy. When she returns to TA full-time, she’ll be a more qualified recruiter. “It always helps to know so I can speak very authentically about the culture of the company and the identity of a very specific team, how they work together and very specific initiatives,” she said. 
 
It’s also giving Harris Lange a reason to stick around. “Throughout my career, I’ve been looking for a place to land where I can expand, where I’m not siloed, where I can use my strengths in different areas, and I feel this is the first place I’ve really been able to do that,” she said.
 
Not All Recruiters Get to Stay in One Shop
 
Still, plenty of recruiters are being let go. Especially at companies that specialize in talent acquisition, layoffs have been sharp. ZipRecruiter, the job posting site, said last month
 it will eliminate about 20% of its workforce
, or about 270 roles. 
 
One recruiter, who asked that her name not be used, told From Day One she was laid off from a major tech company in December. “By November, we knew there was no work,” she said. Having seen plenty of job-market surges come and go, this recruiter is considering whether to switch careers rather than wait out another business cycle. “I feel like recruitment has maybe run its course for me,” she said. “It might just be time for something fresh and new.” Her next stop might be tech sales, where she’s looking for roles now.
 
Transitions to new roles could be easier thanks to the growing reputation of 
HR as a core business function
. Diversity, equity, and inclusion leaders have 
joined the C-suite
, 
HR analytics leaders
 are leading business meetings, and students are seeing 
HR as an onramp to a career as an executive or business owner
. Over half of recruiters who have left the position in the last year have taken other roles in the HR function, but the other half have changed careers, taking roles in sales and business development, operations, or IT, according to 
LinkedIn data
.
 
Highly publicized layoffs in big tech can slant perception of the job market. In the long term, the U.S. economy is
 facing a labor shortage
 because the workforce is aging; even in the short term, some industries are desperately seeking workers. 
LinkedIn’s chief economist Karin Kimbrough told 
Inc.
 in May that the hiring-hungry industries of health care, hospitality, oil and gas, and manufacturing are “bright spots” in the labor market. The economist also noted that workers are investing in themselves. “If you have skills that are in demand, you have currency to maneuver through the job market,” Kimbrough said.
 
Talent acquisition leaders like Molinari and Thornton believe HR needn’t surrender such versatile employees to other fields, and redeploying recruiters across the business may change the perception that TA is a one-note team. “Recruiters are pretty versatile. We have to learn about various jobs,” said Thornton. “That’s the fun part of the business.” 
Read the full story here
.
  
WEBINAR RECAP
  
The Other Caregiving Crisis: How Employers Can Help Workers With Their Hidden Responsibilities: 
While the pandemic revealed a crisis in childcare, it also exposed a crisis in family caregiving for adults. One in five workers has responsibility for the care of one or more adults who are aging, ill, or have special needs, according to research by
 AARP
. Yet more than half of these caregivers don’t tell their supervisors about it. Fortunately, that situation is changing. In a recent survey of 200 leaders in HR conducted by From Day One with support from AARP, 56% of the respondents said that workers are increasingly open with colleagues and managers about caregiving responsibilities, while 60% said that their companies associate support for family caregivers with improving morale and belonging. “Before the pandemic, convincing employers to prioritize their support of working caregivers was an uphill battle,” said Tricia Sandiego, a senior advisor at AARP, in a
 From Day One webinar
 on the issue. But from the survey results, “we learned that there is an increase in awareness. Workers are talking about caregiving, and company leaders do realize and acknowledge that it’s important.” That said, there is still room for improvement: fewer than 15% of respondents said supporting family caregivers was a major priority at their companies. 
Read the full story here
. 
  
LIVE CONFERENCE HIGHLIGHTS
  
Retaining and Motivating Employees by Showing Them Their Work Matters: 
Motivating employees goes hand in hand with keeping them. And neither task is easy. A five-person panel recently went through the ups and downs of that process in a discussion titled “Retaining and Motivating Employees by Showing Them Their Work Matters” at
 From Day One's Minneapolis conference
. It can be tricky to zero in on the intangible sense among employees that their work has meaning. Part of that equation has to do with having employees buy into your company’s mission, according to Laura Lorenz, VP of HR for
 3M
. “The focus is aspirational,” Lorenz said. “We’re the world’s largest provider of N95 masks, and during Covid we kept our prices the same. That was a source of pride for our people.” 
Read the full story here
. 
 
Can We Eradicate Unintentional Bias and Discrimination? Well, We Can Begin: 
Human judgment—and the unconscious biases that it can give rise to—will always be with us. That’s why Jessica Nordell’s acclaimed book
 
The End of Bias
 comes with the subtitle, “A Beginning.” One approach that can help reduce discrimination, Nordell found, is to use objective criteria in making decisions, assessments, and promotions. “It’s not so much about changing hearts and minds as it is about changing the decision-making environment,” said Nordell, an award-winning author and science writer. In assessing the results of anti-bias and anti-discrimination interventions, Nordell focuses on examining data and looking for measurable change, she said at the 
Minneapolis conference
. 
Read the full story here
. 
 
How Well-Being Is a Key Ingredient in Healthy Work Lives and Company Success: 
“It’s a normal part of our company culture to engage with our system of well-being,” said Dr. Jeff Tzeng, the SVP of health and well-being at
 AT&T
, in a fireside chat at
 From Day One’s Dallas conference
. AT&T is focusing on this culture of well-being because they want to increase productivity and make it a better company, said Dr. Jeff, as his colleagues call him. Interviewed by Shelly Hagan, economic development and government reporter at 
Bloomberg
, the doctor shed light on their renewed focus on well-being and the path to a more holistic approach. With a growing recognition of the importance of mental health in the workplace, he said, AT&T has made significant strides to enhance its offerings and support systems. 
Read the full story here
. 
 
After Three Years of Crisis, What Will Keep Employees Engaged and Motivated? 
Over the past three years, workers have had to learn how to adapt and build new skills in order to succeed in a constantly changing work environment. In the aftermath of the pandemic, this same workforce is now experiencing extensive burnout. Now organizations are tasked with finding ways to help their employees get past survival mode, through means of building an inclusive culture that supports a sense of employee engagement. During a panel discussion at 
From Day One’s Brooklyn conference
, moderated by Lydia Dishman of 
Fast Company
, a group of panelists offered their perspective on how their business is renewing a sense of meaning among its employees. 
Read the full story here
.  
  
VIRTUAL EVENTS HIGHLIGHTS
  
Providing Learning and Growth Opportunities for Employees, Even in Austere Times: 
Finding low-cost learning opportunities can be the difference between keeping an employee and losing them. According to an
 international poll by McKinsey
, 41% of workers who quit their jobs in recent years did so because of a lack of career development opportunities, the most commonly cited reason for moving on. “It’s important that we’re retaining our employees because we need that knowledge internally,” said Nicole Underwood, VP of HR business partners at 
Getty Images
. During
 From Day One’s May virtual conference
, Underwood and four other leaders discussed how to provide career development opportunities for employees even in austere times. 
Read the full story here
. 
 
Unlocking Our Full Potential: Breaking Free from Limiting Habits and Jobs: 
Even the most accomplished individuals in their field deal with the feeling of being stuck. Adam Alter, author of 
Anatomy of a Breakthrough: How to Get Unstuck
 
When It Matters Most
, relays that Lionel Messi, perhaps the greatest living soccer player, is famously anxious. When he was starting out, coaches noted that, while physically and athletically accomplished, he lacked the temperament to be a champion. Messi subsequently had to learn to quell his anxiety, and his solution might seem paradoxical. “He learned to start the game by not playing for the first few minutes,” Alter told journalist Lila Seidman of the 
Los Angeles Times
 during the
 May virtual conference
. “He spends the first two to three minutes just ambling around. If you plot the path, everybody is darting around. Messi is barely moving. It quells his anxiety, but he’s also tactically beneficial, he’s surveying the territory.” 
Read the full story here
. 
With a Bumper Crop of New Options, Benefits Leaders Need to Make Smart Choices:
 It’s no secret that employees expect more from employers than they did five years ago. Companies have offered innovative solutions from pet care to travel-as-a-benefit to meet the demand. But companies only have so many resources, especially nowadays, as the economy begins to decline. “Many of us are thinking about coming out of this couple of years of such an intensive talent and labor market, where a lot of companies have been under pressure to offer more and more,” said Joanna Daly, VP of total rewards at
 IBM
. “So I do think we're at an inflection point.” As a result, employers have to make choices about what benefits are the most valuable to employees and prospective hires. Daly spoke with moderator Bryan Walsh, editor for Future Project at
 Vox Media
, at
 From Day One’s virtual April conference
, “Creative Total Rewards to Set Employers Apart,” during a fireside chat session. 
Read the full story here
.
  
QUICK HITS
  
Companies Quiet Their Diversity and Sustainability Talk Amid Culture War Boycotts: 
The Wall Street Journal 
reports that companies’ mentions of green and social initiatives during earnings calls have fallen off sharply in recent quarters, reversing a more boastful approach taken over the past few years amid intensifying pressure from some investors and conservative activists. Take electronic-signature firm 
DocuSign
, where chief financial officer Cynthia Gaylor in March 2022 said the company achieved carbon-neutral status during the year ended that January. Gaylor, who is set to step down as CFO this month, at the time said the company was continuing its efforts to reach net-zero emissions no later than 2050. 
Read the full story here
. 
 
How Remote Work Connected Employees Making $19 an Hour and $80,000 a Year: 
Eric Deshawn Lerma felt waves of anxiety when he sat down to tally the new costs in his routine since Amazon’s return to the office this spring. There’s parking. There’s fuel. There’s lunch. They add up to at least $200 extra a month, all to support a policy whose justification he can’t fully understand—after three years in which he and his teammates have been doing their jobs from home. In this context, according to 
The New York Times
, large crowds of workers walked off the job at Amazon’s Seattle headquarters last month for one hour during lunchtime. They were protesting the company’s return-to-office rule, among other issues including layoffs and the company’s impact on the climate, and carried signs with slogans like “Just Say No to RTO.” Weeks earlier, employees voiced their frustrations with the return-to-office policy in a Remote Advocacy channel, with over 30,000 members, on the Slack workplace messaging system. 
Read the full story here
. 
 
Revenge Served Ice Cold:
 Last month, Lewis Brisbois Bisgaard & Smith, one of the nation’s largest law firms, was rocked by the announcement that two top partners were starting their own boutique practice and taking as many as 140 colleagues with them. The shock inside Lewis Brisbois’ downtown Los Angeles headquarters soon gave way to anger as the recently departed partners embarked on a press campaign that portrayed their former employer as a profit-focused legal mill. In an extraordinary move, as detailed in the Los Angeles Times, its management team directed the release of scores of emails in which Barber and Ranen used vile terms and offensive stereotypes. Their former employer had received an anonymous complaint about the former partners, which recommended the firm scrutinize the emails of both men. In a statement, the firm said it was  “shocked to find dozens of emails … with unacceptable, prejudiced language aimed at our colleagues, clients, attorneys from other firms, and even judges.” 
Read the full story here
. 
  
SPONSOR SPOTLIGHTS
  
CLAIRA
 
Searching for Competency: How AI Can Make Management More Inclusive–and Effective: 
While much of the conversation about artificial intelligence has focused on the frightening ways AI could disrupt social institutions—
or much worse
—what’s often overlooked is how much businesses are already using it. In a survey, 42% of HR professionals at companies with more than 5,000 workers said they use AI and other automation to support HR activities,
 according to a 2022 poll
 of HR leaders by the Society of Human Resource Management (SHRM). The top areas for using AI: recruiting and hiring, learning and development, and performance management. Even so, more than half of the AI-using professionals said they have run into challenges, including AI accidentally overlooking or excluding qualified candidates. How can companies use AI in ways that are both more inclusive and effective? They could focus much less on credentials and more on skills and aptitude. “We think competencies level the playing field,” said Katie Hall, CEO and founder of
 Claira
, a workforce-management platform powered by AI that measures workers’ competencies to improve hiring, engagement and employee retention. “Everyone everywhere has competencies. We think that the system has to change and be set up in such a way that we don’t make permanent mistakes with the AI revolution that’s coming.” 
Read the full story here
.
 
STORK CLUB
 
Holistic Wellness for Women: Supporting Health in Every Life Phase:
 It began with a goal to increase the number of women in their workforce. The plan was to create a suite of benefits that appeal to women, starting with maternity health coverage. “As we heard from our employee resource groups, that’s something that was valuable to them,” said Amy Rennock, chief HR officer at 
Jamf Software
, which builds Apple device management technology. Ultimately, the company’s search for an inclusive, family-building health plan changed the way Jamf thinks about providing health care. “We have a lot of men who have families that are served by this benefit. We have a lot of trans employees who are getting services and feeling supported.” Rennock told Jamf’s story during a recent 
From Day One webinar
, alongside Liz Pittinger, head of global customer success at 
Stork Club
, Jamf’s family-building benefits partner. 
Read the full story here
.
AVENICA
 
Embracing a New Era of Talent Assessment: 
Leonardo da Vinci gets credit for inventing, among other things, the parachute, the armored car and the resume. Some 500-plus years later, employers still use the resume to assess job seekers’ potential. That’s a problem, accelerated today with resume-scanning algorithms that can introduce biases and exclude many aspiring job candidates. “Resumes don’t predict a damn thing,” Scott Dettman, CEO of
 Avenica
, said during a presentation at 
From Day One’s conference in Minneapolis
. Dettman should know. He helped prove that resumes have no predictive value while working at ManpowerGroup. A massive study there, done with Google and Cognizant, concluded that resumes cannot forecast how a job applicant will perform. Or even whether someone will get hired. 
Read the full story here
. 
ACCOLADE
Empower Your Workforce With Health Navigators, Guiding Employees Through Pivotal Moments: 
More than a quarter of all health care dollars are wasted due to failed care delivery, lack of care coordination, or unnecessary treatment. It’s an astounding percentage, exacerbated by rising health care costs. Given corporate focus on cost containment, it is an issue that companies need to address. The wasted money is a symptom of a larger problem, though: how to provide health care solutions to employees that are attractive, useful, and cost effective. In a
 From Day One webinar
, two executives from the health navigation company
 Accolade
 talked about how this kind of service can help achieve cost containment, better outcomes, and stellar appreciation from users. 
Read the full story here
. 
  
  
UPCOMING EVENTS
  
WEBINARS
 
Get credit! From Day One is accredited by the professional organizations SHRM and HRCI, and most of our sessions qualify for professional development credit from both organizations. See our individual event-registration pages for credit details. 
 
June 27: The Evolution of Employee Listening. 
Forms of employee listening, and measurement of employee engagement have been a part of organizations for over a century to improve the employee experience and curb attrition. Over the decades, approaches have been modernized and companies are implementing more holistic employee listening strategies. This has become a critical shift as the workplace has changed and modernized in the past few years, and this session will share combined experiences and learnings from hundreds of organizations that have upgraded their approach to employee listening. 
Register now
.
 
June 29: Attracting Non-Traditional and Diverse Talent.  
Every company is a tech company. Maintaining a competitive edge in business begins and ends with how diverse talent and innovation is fostered, created, and developed. How can qualified, non-degreed, and diverse entry-level talent be sourced for your tech teams? Additionally, what can companies do to retain in-demand talent and build a sense of belonging across their workforce? 
Register now
.
 
July 11: Attract Loyal Hourly Workers by Diversifying Your Sourcing Strategy. 
Job boards are slowly becoming a thing of the past. Applicants use them to apply to multiple jobs at once—rather than to find the job they’re really excited about. To increase your chances of hiring hourly workers who are more likely to stick around, you need to implement a diverse, active sourcing strategy. Join industry expert Jackie Adams to learn the top strategies businesses can employ to increase applicant quality and build a stronger hourly workforce. 
Register now
. 
 
Aug. 3: How the Definition of Total Rewards Is Changing. 
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
 
Oct. 10: Why Women’s Health Benefits Are Essential to Retention. 
Women’s health can be a high cost driver for employers. Additionally, offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But women’s health in general is not just one condition. Join us for this fireside chat in which Dr. Leslie Saltzman, Ovia Health’s chief medical officer, explains the different facets of women’s health (like menopause, fertility, and maternity care management), what areas generate the most ROI, and how employers can offer the deepest, and most all-encompassing benefits to support and delight their employees and medically supported dependents. 
Register now
. 
 
Nov. 9: How Tech Can Boost Engagement and Recognition.
 In a distributed workforce, how can employers promote both team cohesion and making individual employees feel "seen" by their managers and peers? What have business leaders learned in the past two years about which technologies and practices are motivational and informative, vs. fatiguing or counterproductive? 
Register now
. 
 
LIVE EVENTS
 
Join us in the real world! We hosted 14 single-day live conferences around the U.S. in 2022 and we have an even more ambitious slate underway in 2023. Our live events are also eligible for SHRM and HRCI credits.

Click Here For Tickets
.
 
VIRTUAL CONFERENCES
 
July 19: 
Innovation in Family Health: How Companies Can Take Personalized Approach
. 
Family health has taken on new dimensions over the past few years, as employers have recognized that in geographically distributed workplaces, employees face different circumstances when it comes to the availability and quality of fertility care, pediatric care, child care, education, and after-school programming. How can companies invested in family-friendly and caregiving benefits adapt to the variety of needs in their workforces? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
July 26: 
The New Keys to Employee Satisfaction, Recognition, and Retention
. 
The right combination of total rewards, career advancement, and corporate purpose has been a moving target in recent years as workers reconsider their priorities. How can companies accentuate the benefits of sticking with  their organizations, emphasizing factors including personal growth, fulfillment, and benefits tailored to their individual needs? Which tools can accurately measure employee satisfaction, and how can managers augment their effect? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Aug. 9: 
The Changing Profile of HR Leaders: How the Role Is Evolving and Growing
.
 In just the past two years, HR has risen to the C-suite level in influence and responsibility. How should HR leaders respond in terms of preparing for changing roles, managing their new duties, and charting their own career paths? What can HR leaders do to leverage their new prominence to make change happen across the whole organization? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Sept. 20: 
Building a Healthy Work Environment to Persevere Through Multiple Challenges
. 
Organizations offering health care and wellness benefits maintain a stronger sense of employee loyalty. Yet health and well-being among employees goes beyond acute or specific physical or mental health needs. How can companies create a culture that emphasizes health through everyday experience? What are the hidden opportunities to nurture this kind of culture? Rather than relying only on standard  benefits to respond in times of unexpected distress, how can organizations address employee needs proactively? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Sept. 27: 
Giving Workers Direction About Skills and Career Development
. 
Many workers yearn to grow and advance in their careers, yet don’t have an understanding of how to develop their skills and experience  for a role with more responsibility. Learning and  development can help not only by showing the many possibilities, but also with vision to help employees find the learning and development path that will enable the most fulfilling growth according to their own interests. What can organizations do to deploy coaching in a way that helps not only with short-term goals but also the long arc of a worker’s career? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Oct. 11: 
How HR Technology Can Connect, Motivate, and Recognize the Hybrid Workforce
. 
Most workers have strongly embraced hybrid and remote work arrangements, having settled into sustainable routines that allow them to be productive. But camaraderie and a sense of belonging have proven elusive without meaningful face-to-face contact and team-building opportunities. How can organizations create new structures for in-person gatherings that maintain the comfort of remote or hybrid work, as well as new digital approaches that create the ties that bind? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Nov. 8: 
Casting a Wider Net: Fresh, Productive Approaches to Diversity Recruiting
. 
Many companies fall short of their diversity-hiring goals because they keep looking in the same places–and with the same techniques and expectations. What are the best ways for employers to break out of these patterns? How can they reconsider their job specifications to bring in more non-traditional candidates and prospects who could thrive with a modest amount of training and upskilling? What are the new and innovative ways to strengthen a diverse pipeline? 
Register here to attend
. 
 
Dec. 13: 
The Arc of Change for People and Culture in 2024
. 
Recent history affirms that unpredictable events will buffet the workplace of 2024, yet the trajectory of trends in 2023 gives an indication of how organizations will need to be ready for changing expectations among workers and other stakeholders. What are the emerging patterns that leaders should watch in the realms of diversity and inclusion, talent acquisition, employee rewards, learning and development, social responsibility and sustainability? What new points of focus will arrive in the greater field of people and culture? 
Register here to attend
. 
  
  
 
  
YOU'RE GETTING THIS BECAUSE: 
  
You're getting the The From Day One newsletter because you signed up on our website or during the application process for one of our events. We send this newsletter once a month.
If you like it, you're in luck: we'll send you another one next month. If you'd prefer to unsubscribe just click the link below and we'll take care of it.

Dear Khadija,
 
Beginning in 2020, we saw a resurgence of companies making unprecedented commitments to advancing DEI in the workplace. However, recently, we're hearing that many of these DEI initiatives are stalling. If this is happening in your workplace, I want to share a few resources with you.
 
On 
Tuesday, May 30 at 12pm
, we are going to be hosting a webinar called “Ask an Expert Anything: Responding to Resistance to DEI,” facilitated by Executive Coach and Master Facilitator Jeffrey Cookson, GPHR, SPHR. This forum will be safe space to explore ways to overcome resistance in the workplace and will help you to identity specific language to use and avoid when resistance surfaces.
 
In addition, we know that 2023 is halfway over, but there is still time to make impact. 
Right now, LCW is offering a 30% discount on any new statement of work signed by June 30, 2023.
 If there is anything that you need or any program that you're curious about, let me know. I'd be happy to help you.

subject: Summertime Resume Boost: Earn the PMQ
body:
Better managers create better workplaces.
 
 
 
87% of Participants Say the SHRM PMQ Helped Them Gain Leadership Confidence
 
 
 
 
 
 
Ready to manage a team or brush up on your leadership skills?
 Whether it's on the beach or chillin’ pool side, boost your resume and show employers you’re ready to lead with SHRM’s 
People Manager Qualification (PMQ)
.
 
The PMQ
 is an on-demand experience, designed to equip you to
 lead and motivate
 colleagues effectively. The platform is 
available anytime, anywhere, 
and discounts are available 
for team purchases
!
 
 
 
START LEARNING NOW
 
 
 
 
HOW DOES THE PMQ WORK?
 
 
 
 
 
Interactive content flows
 like a streaming series in 
quick-hit episodes,
 broken out into three seasons. 
 
 
 
 
Assessments
 at the end of each season 
unlock
 the next season, with a final evaluation after the third season. 
 
 
 
 
Download your certificate
 and badge to show you’re 
People Manager Qualified 
& add it to your resume! 
 
 
 
WAIT! It appears you’re not a SHRM member! Join today and save up to 20% off the PMQ with exclusive member pricing!

body:
Hi Hannah Strack,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 hour: 
WorkPride 2023
:
 The impact of an LGBTQ+ officers – the impact, purpose and value of hiring one in to your organisation 
Date & Time
Jun 19, 2023 21:00 London
Webinar ID
852 2089 9416
Description
LGBTQ+ senior leadership, and visible role models, can make all the difference for staff to be able to see themselves at work and be able to exist confidently and comfortably at the office. On this panel, we’ll be hearing about how LGBTQ+ Officers can support staff, as well as help companies to ensure that they are implementing policies which enable everyone to be their authentic self in the workplace. subject: Last Chance! [Webinar] Using Skills to Supercharge Your Talent Management Strategy
body:
Last chance to join us for this complimentary webinar.
View this email  in your browser
Using Skills to Supercharge Your Talent Management Strategy
 
  
20
JUN
2023
@ 1 p.m. ET
  
Register Now
Skills are key to achieving peak performance across your organization. By putting an organization’s people at the heart of everything we do, we can not only increase internal skills and capabilities but also improve employee retention via clear skills pathways, equity and internal mobility.   
Join us for this complimentary Training Industry 
webinar
, sponsored by LearningPool. Your hosts, from LearningPool, Lindsey Coode, head of innovation, and Christoph Küffer, director of skills, will help you to find out how easy it can be to understand your organization’s skills landscape and use this knowledge to help design and drive a game-changing talent management strategy that will ensure you have the skills your organization needs to succeed.
This interactive webinar will provide easy-to-understand insights on:
The importance of knowing the skills you have in your organization now and those you will need in the future.
How to get started with skills-based talent management.
How an effective skills strategy can improve employee engagement and retention.
Upskilling and reskilling your people so they can perform at their best.
How to close skills gaps via effective interventions.
Register Now
Can’t attend the live event? Register anyway, and watch the recording when it’s available.
Our webinars are pre-qualified for 
one credit hour
 with leading HR and training certifications. 
Learn more
.

Raleigh, NC 27615-6520

body:
Hi Hannah Strack,
This is a reminder that your webinar will begin in 1 hour: 
WorkPride 2023
:
 The Do's & Don'ts of Trans Inclusion 
Date & Time
Jun 19, 2023 13:00 London
Webinar ID
815 6069 6420
Description
Against the backdrop of increasing hostility against the trans community, it is vital that we - as allies - do everything we can to be inclusive and uplift our trans friends, employees, and family. Over the course of the hour, our panel will explore the things that you and your workplace can do to be more inclusive of trans people, as well as discussing the mistakes, misconceptions, and slip-ups that we can all learn from. Sign up now!

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 June 18, 2023
body:
The corporate training landscape map, D&I job aid and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
June is Pride month, drawing awareness to learning and development’s (L&D’s) role in supporting LGBTQ+ employees and underrepresented groups in the workplace. Investing in L&D initiatives, like LGBTQ+ inclusivity training, can help create an inclusive and equitable company culture for everyone.
This week we have a ton of resources to help you foster an inclusive work environment for your organization’s people. Check out this
 job aid
 to learn how training managers can become diversity and inclusion (D&I) champions.
If you want to keep up with top L&D trends and tips, take a look at this curated list of L&D podcasts in 
this guide
. You can also kickstart the summer by taking advantage of Training Industry Courses’ 
sale
 to receive a discount on all Training Industry courses, including the leading Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™) program.
Of course, we love hearing from you. Please send any comments, questions and article pitches to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Danielle Murdaugh 
Associate Editor
2023 Corporate Training Landscape Map
Training Industry just released the latest Corporate Training Landscape Map to help organizations find the right partner for their training needs. This graphic shows the key companies in 16 unique market segments that together represent the entire landscape of corporate training. This information is developed based on data analysis behind the Training Industry Top Training Companies lists (Top 20 and Watch Lists) as well as our own proprietary industry research.
View the Map
 
[Job Aid] Helping Training Managers Become D&I Champions
June is Pride month! To learn how you, as a learning leader, can support LGBTQ+ employees — and all employees from underrepresented groups — download this complimentary job aid, courtesy of Training Industry's Building D&I Training Programs Workshop. Because equitable work isn't just a business priority: It's a human priority. 
Get the Guide
 
The Ultimate L&D Podcast Guide
Are you looking for some new ways to stay on top of L&D trends and tips? The training industry has developed many great podcasts on a variety of L&D topics to help you do just that. Training Industry, which hosts our own podcast, The Business of Learning, has gathered some of the best and most popular L&D podcasts for you in this guide.
Check It Out
 
Kickstart Summer With Training Industry Courses' Sale!
Take advantage of this opportunity to receive discounts on all Training Industry Courses — including the leading Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™) program. Use code SUMMER10 at checkout for 10% off any course before June 30! We want to ensure that you have the skills, knowledge and resources necessary to improve organizational outcomes and gain a seat at the decision-making table. With a comprehensive suite of certifications, certificates and workshops, Training Industry Courses has a program for you.
Start Saving 
 
DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION 
Best Practices for LGBTQ+ Inclusivity Training

Immersive learning technologies, VR/AR and mixed reality, provide unique opportunities for interactive and immersive onboarding experiences.

PERSONALIZATION AND LEARNING PATHWAYS

Let’s explore some of the ways that AI can be used to lighten the load on L&D professionals, as well as impact the company’s bottom line.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION

PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT

Time to step up your presentations
With Miro, you can present to impress. Here's some some tried-and-true techniques and templates on Miro to run an engaging presentation and get 'wows' from the crowd
Create a Presentation in Miro →
 
 
Make them feel alive
Keep your audience engaged by encourage them to use board reactions and respond in real time.
 
Make them look good
Combine colors to create depth and hierarchy, and use contrasting colors to highlight the critical content.
 
Import outside slides
Incorporate slides from PowerPoint and Google Slides with an easy drag & drop on the board. Then, 
extract the slides
 you want to use.
 
Ask questions with stickies
Give everyone a voice and create a section on your board with sticky notes to get your audience questions and comments.
 
Get ready in 10 mins
Here's some presentation templates that will save you time — just add your content and images and you’re ready to impress.
Check them here →
 
Happy collaborating,
The Miro Team

HBR STORE
 
 
 
Maximize your influence as a manager
 
Whether you’re a new manager or looking to have more influence in your current role, the 
Management Essentials Set
 will help you strengthen your skills in all core business areas. 
 
Each book in this curated seven-volume collection is packed with valuable insight and advice on perennial issues you’ll face as a manager. Plus, you get plenty of tools and best practices to help solve whatever comes your way. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
The set includes these bestselling ebooks:
 
 
HBR’s 10 Must Reads: The Essentials
 
If you read nothing else, read these 10 articles from HBR’s most influential authors, all intended to help boost your organization’s performance and your own.
 
 
 
 
Peter F. Drucker on Management Essentials
 
The gold standard for managers, this book focuses on timeless aspects of management—addressing essential issues like resource allocation, productivity challenges, innovation, and risk management. 
 
 
 
 
 
HBR Manager’s Handbook: The 17 Skills Leaders Need to Stand Out
 
Reach your full leadership potential by mastering 17 core business and personal skills in crucial areas from financial statements and strategy fundamentals to emotional intelligence and building trust.
 
 
 
 
HBR Project Management Handbook: How to Launch, Lead and Sponsor Successful Projects
 
So much of today’s work is project-driven, making project management skills essential for every manager. Discover a proven framework that will increase any project’s likelihood of success.
 
 
 
 
Leading Change
 
Become better equipped to lead transformative change with John Kotter’s seminal work on change management. Equal parts visionary guide and practical toolkit, it will help you avoid common pitfalls.
 
 
 
 
HBR Guide to Managing Strategic Initiatives
 
By putting strategy into action, you can transform your company and your career. Learn how to win and keep support for your initiative, stay on schedule and within budget and align multiple initiatives.
 
 
 
 
HBR Guide to Motivating People
 
Find out how to better motivate your team and help individuals reach their full potential. You’ll also learn how to address common challenges like lackluster performance, burnout, and low engagement. 
 
 
 
This specially priced ebook set is a timeless management library you’ll refer to again and again as you face new challenges and opportunities throughout your career.

subject: [Webinar] Culture Matters: Enhance Learner Engagement Through Localization
body:
Join us for this complimentary webinar.
View this email  in your browser
Culture Matters: Enhance Learner Engagement Through Localization
 
  
21
JUN
2023
@ 11 a.m. ET
  
Register Now
Language matters. When training content is not only in the learner’s first language, but rooted in their culture, it can have a better impact. Effective localization of content, especially learning content, needs much more than just a basic translation of words and phrases. Taking account of the subtle intricacies involved in the mix of language and culture is crucial to successful learner engagement and the achievement of better learning outcomes.
Join us in this complimentary Training Industry webinar, sponsored by RWS. Your host, Rachel Cary, eLearning solutions consultant of RWS, will explore real-life examples of an alternative to the traditional localization model of “English-first translation.” Backed by our concurrent authoring approach, we’ll walkthrough how to create learning content where language and cultural connections work to deliver a positive and engaging learning experience. 
In this webinar, you will learn:
​​​​​The importance of considering the cultural background of learners when creating content.
An alternative to the traditional localization model of “English-first translation.”
Why subtle intricacies involved in language and culture is critical to learner engagement and outcomes. 
Register Now

subject: Creating The Life Satisfaction, You Desire: The Myth of Balance
body:
Creating The Life Satisfaction, You Desire: The Myth of Balance
Live Webinar | 
Beverly Beuermann-King
 
| Jun 30, 2023 , 01 : 00 PM EST | 60 Minutes
Get 
"$29"
 off. Eligibility Code: 
"SAVE29"
Register Now
Description:-
Many have noticed that their work-life boundaries have blurred, and they have not taken a real break since the start of the pandemic.
It is essential that we find the strategies to manage our energy, focus on happiness, and integrate all aspects of our life. But how do we do that when we are time-pressured, reactive, tired out, and running on empty? Failing to focus on taking a break and creating balance and life satisfaction can lead to burnout, mental health challenges, and a variety of physical health repercussions.
Examine your personal Wheel of Life and discover how you allocate your energy. By applying simplicity strategies to the S-O-S Principle, you will be able to discover a renewed sense of balance, engagement, and health.
Areas Covered:-
Key messages:
Balance does not mean equal
Balance is continually changing
Balance and life satisfaction are activities that you continually engage in as you make corrections throughout the day, week, and months ahead. Focus is on more of what you love and less of what you loathe
As we move through challenge and out of crisis mode and transition into the next phase of adjustments, focusing on balance and life satisfaction is a critical part of staying mentally fit
Simplicity: Small shifts can make major impacts on how engaged and satisfied you are with your life
You owe it to yourself to make sure you are maintaining a healthy work-life balance that allows you to thrive, both personally and professionally
Participants will:
Discover the results that a lack of balance has and the way that it is impacting their productivity, health, and enjoyment and that of their teams
Identify the many areas of priority and importance in life. Examine the Wheel of Life model to map strategies for how we allocate our energy
Focus on Simplicity. Small shifts can make major impacts on how engaged and satisfied you are with your life
Understand and identify the many energy drainers and utilize energy boosters to free up mental and physical energy
Gain clarity, a sense of direction, and motivation to live life with contentment, calmness, and connection
Why You Should Attend:-
Research shows that this is a normal response when a crisis occurs, but as the pandemic wears on, it is important to regain the focus on living a full and flourishing life despite the circumstances.
Balance can feel like an unrealistic dream. Balance is an activity that you must continually engage in as you make corrections and adjustments based on circumstances. Balance becomes the harmonious simplification and integration of all aspects of life, including coping with business disruption, working remotely, and other impacts of the pandemic.
Examine your personal Wheel of Life and discover how you allocate your energy. By applying simplicity strategies to the S-O-S Principle, you will be able to discover a renewed sense of balance, engagement, and health during this current challenge and as you move forward.

Embrace the "always-learning" mindset and thrive. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

In a world where artificial intelligence (AI) threatens job security, it's time to rewrite the script and empower ourselves with the ultimate weapon: learning fitness. Say goodbye to fear-based performance and hello to a future where continuous learning drives high performance, engagement and revenue.
Get ready to be inspired by Kristy McCann Flynn, co-founder and CEO of SkillCycle during this featured session at the 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
. She'll reveal the secrets to adopting an "always-learning" mindset that will not only safeguard your career but also propel your organization to new heights.
Don’t miss out on this opportunity to find out how to conquer the future with learning fitness! 
Register
 now for TICE 2023 and add this session to your personal agenda!

subject: Stay Ahead of AI With Learning Fitness — Join This TICE 2023 Session!
body:
Embrace the "always-learning" mindset and thrive. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
View this email in your browser
 
In a world where artificial intelligence (AI) threatens job security, it's time to rewrite the script and empower ourselves with the ultimate weapon: learning fitness. Say goodbye to fear-based performance and hello to a future where continuous learning drives high performance, engagement and revenue.
Get ready to be inspired by Kristy McCann Flynn, co-founder and CEO of SkillCycle during this featured session at the 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
. She'll reveal the secrets to adopting an "always-learning" mindset that will not only safeguard your career but also propel your organization to new heights.
Don’t miss out on this opportunity to find out how to conquer the future with learning fitness! 
Register
 now for TICE 2023 and add this session to your personal agenda!
 
Register Now
EVENT PARTNERS
 
  
Follow along with the latest #TICE2023 updates!​
 
View in Browser
 | 
Update Subscription Preferences

subject: LCW Follow-Up: Hope Chicago
body:
Hello Claudia,
 
It was a pleasure meeting with you as well and chatting about the needs at Hope Chicago! 
 
We are currently putting together a proposal for a half-day of training with 2 separate facilitators and will have that information to you as soon as possible. In the meantime, I want to let you know that your main contacts for this project will be Alisa, who you met, and Melissa Neu, LCW’s Business Development Manager. I’ve also copied our Chief of Staff, Briza Cardenas, to help with scheduling as needed. 
 
In terms of scheduling, only Alisa is available at 4pm on Wednesday and both Melissa and Alisa are available on Friday at 3pm. I will put a tentative hold on all of your schedules to save the dates.
 
I am sure this will be an amazing training for your team and thank you for your interest with LCW!
 
Best,
Hannah
 
------------------------------------------------------
Hannah Strack – she/her
Business Development Associate 
Email: 
h.strack@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1 773-828-1202 [EST]

From:
 Claudia Hall <claudia@hopechicago.org> 
Sent:
 Thursday, June 15, 2023 4:53 PM
To:
 Hannah Strack <h.strack@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Hope Chicago
 
Hannah,
 
It was great meeting you today! If your team could send over a proposal for a half-day of training with 2 separate facilitators that would be great. If you have any other documents or visuals that have information about the training that I could share with my team that would be great, too. 
 
Also, I was just trying to look at my calendar to give your team a few more meeting time options next week: 
 
Wednesday @ 11:30 am or 4:00 pm 
Friday @ 3:00 pm 
 
Thank you so much!
CLAUDIA HALL (she/her)
DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATE
main office: +1 (312) 477-3174
303 East Wacker Drive, Suite 2109
Chicago, Illinois 60601

body:

Thanks for coming together to talk about how LCW might have a more global framework beginning in 2023 for public behaviors (such as external comms, branded on-screen backgrounds, etc.) related to affinity months, etc.
 
Potential agenda items for this call
How to identify affinity months celebrated in different world regions, international days of recognition, religious holidays, etc., that we want to recognize in some way
Coordinating related efforts and timelines
Other considerations identified during the call

body:
Jeffrey Cookson deleted an event: Zoom's new wipe board annotation feature Hi All – Larry and I are going to explore a new zoom fea...
 
 
 
Log in → 
Jeffrey Cookson deleted an event: 
Zoom's new wipe board annotation feature
 
Hi All – Larry and I are going to explore a new zoom feature – a wipe board for annotation that operates outside of the deck shared during a training sesh. We’re hopeful that some of you can join us briefly to test it out with a group and get feedback on what, if anything, people might think could be advantages or disadvantages to using this format instead of the current  way we use annotation.
 
If you can pls join us from 10-1020am on F5Aug – no worries if you can’t thanks!

subject: Stay up-to-date on your benefits offerings.
body:
Find out how at this virtual retreat
 
  
Stay up-to-date 
on your benefits offerings. 
  
  
As an HR professional, you are intimately familiar with the constantly evolving expectations your employees have for their 
benefits packages
. 
Those expectations change alongside employee 
demographics
, the 
cost of living
 and 
technology advancements
. It can be hard to keep up, especially when you know how important benefits offerings are to 
improving employee retention
 and 
staying competitive
 in the current talent landscape. 
But don’t worry! The 
SHRM Benefits Trends Virtual Retreat
 on Thursday, Aug. 17, is here to help. 
You’ll hear from thought leaders and industry experts on everything from the 
child care crisis
 and 
mental health
 to 
financial wellness
 and 
women's health
. 
This 
FREE
 retreat is designed with busy professionals like you in mind. Register for the whole retreat or just a few sessions—it’s up to you and what works best for 
your
 schedule. 
  
  
SECURE YOUR SPOT TODAY!
 
  
 
 
Connect with us on social!
 
  
  
  
  
 
1800 Duke Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314 USA 
Contact Us
 | 
shrm.org
